4853	An intricately carved altar honoring the goddess. An engraving depicts\nher as an elegantly winged young woman surrounded by stars and\naccompanied by dragons.
4854	The Officers Academy is within sight. It is comprised of three\ndistinct houses: the Black Eagles, led by Edelgard, the Blue Lions,\nled by Dimitri, and the Golden Deer, led by Claude.
4855	A sheet of paper with carefully curated information about different types\nof fishing bait and best tackle practices. Whoever wrote this knows a\ngreat deal about fishing.
4856	A list of the different types of fish that can be caught in the fishing pond.\nIt's downright comprehensive.
4857	A list of the places where fish are most likely to gather in the\nfishing pond. Someone put a lot of thought into this.
4858	An exhaustive explanation of techniques to encourage fish to bite the\nbait when they go in for a nibble. Who knew there was this much to\nknow about fishing?
4859	A list of different seed types and how best to plant them.\nIt's a wealth of knowledge for aspiring gardeners.
4860	Detailed information about the different varieties of crops that have been\nsuccessfully cultivated in the greenhouse. It's very informative.
4861	A list of the different pests that target plants during cultivation,\ncomplete with methods of eradication for each. You wouldn't\nwant to be a bug in THIS greenhouse, that's for sure.
4862	An illustrated beginner's guide to the basics of fishing. It includes\nin-depth descriptions of the types of bait that are most appealing to\ndifferent species of fish. It's an excellent resource for fishing novices.
4863	This advanced text explains the ecology and origins of freshwater fish.\nIt delves into the many different schools of thought surrounding the\nsubject without being inaccessible for the ichthyology layman.\nYou feel smarter just looking at it.
4864	A practical guide for surviving in the great outdoors without the\nconveniences of civilization. It offers advice and techniques on many\nsubjects, including hunting and gathering, setting up camp, and securing\npotable water. You can almost hear the call of the wild.
4865	An illustrated beginner's guide to the basics of greenhouse gardening.\nIt includes detailed descriptions of standard procedures and common\npitfalls. It's the perfect book for anyone with a budding passion\nfor gardening.
4866	A highly accessible illustrated guide to different types of crops,\noptimum growing conditions, and crop-specific cooking methods.\nEven the greenest of green thumbs should be able to follow along.
4867	An encyclopedia dedicated to every type of fish in F√≥dlan, as well as all\nof their various habitats. It is the product of a collaboration between\ncountless fisherman and monastery students, who compiled a thorough\ncollection of studies regarding the habits of fish, advanced fishing\nmethods, and even recipes. The level of detail is staggering.
4868	An encyclopedia dedicated to every type of plant growing in F√≥dlan,\nas well as the various locations where they can be found. The information\nand detailed renderings within were compiled by the church, and it is\nconsidered an unrivaled resource for plants and cultivation techniques.\nIt's honestly a bit intimidating.

4875	A recipe for dried morphis plum preserves.\nEating it will result in a temporary Dex +5 boost.\nIt seems it can be made by cooking.
4876	A recipe for baked Amid Pike with nordsalat.\nEating it will result in a temporary Speed+5 boost.\nIt seems it can be made by cooking.
4877	A recipe for deep-fried queen loach stuffed with Magdred kirsch.\nEating it will result in a temporary Res+5 boost.\nIt seems it can be made by cooking.
4878	A statue of Saint Cethleann, one of the Four Saints. It is said that she was\na beautiful and kind soul who was beloved by all for her empathy and her\nability to heal severe wounds. She is the daughter of Saint Cichol.
4879	A statue of Saint Cichol, one of the Four Saints. It is said that he was a\ncompassionate yet stern figure whose faith was so true he was able to\nperform miracles. He is the father of Saint Cethleann.
4880	A statue of Saint Indech, one of the Four Saints. It is said that he was\nknown for his wisdom and dexterity. Though unskilled in the art of\nhuman interaction, he used his gifts to help those in need. He was also\nan indomitable warrior who slew countless foes on countless battlefields.
4881	A statue of Saint Macuil, one of the Four Saints. It is said that his gift for\nstrategy was unparalleled. He served as the chief tactician of Saint Seiros\nand was a pioneering figure for and master of the magical arts.
4882	The Revelation\nThe goddess is all things. She is heaven above and the land below.\nShe is eternity incarnate. She is the present, the past, and the future.\nHer eyes see all. Her ears hear all. Her hands receive all.
4883	She who was graced with the holy word of the divine goddess,\nwho bore witness to her magnificence, is the one called Seiros.\nShe is the messenger of the heavens, the bridge between the lands\nabove and below, and her blessings shall bring tidings of peace to all.
4884	With the goddess's omnipotence and wisdom to guide her,\nSeiros ensures that her will be done.\nAs the goddess's sword, Seiros wards away evil.\nAs the goddess's child, Seiros makes emperors of mortals.\nAs the goddess's wings, Seiros elevates her people.\nAs the goddess's voice, Seiros spreads the word of love.
4885	That sublime sword is entrusted to you.\nThose emperors are crowned before you.\nThose wings clear your path.\nThat voice whispers words of trust.\nMay the blessings of the goddess follow you, always.
4886	The Creation\nIn the beginning, amid the great cloudless ocean, F√≥dlan came to be.\nAt the end of a long journey, the goddess glimpsed that land and there\nalighted. Upon that sacred ground, she breathed life into the world and\ncreated all of the creatures upon it.
4887	By the goddess's hand, plants took root, birds took to the sky,\nand animals roamed the land. Last of all, she created humanity.\nWhen the humans wished for power, she granted it. She gifted them\nthe blessings of the heavens and of the earth. By way of the magical arts,\nhumanity attained great power, yet unaware that great power portends\ngreat evil.
4888	By the grace of the goddess's divine protection, humanity thrived.\nThrough her blessings, they grew prosperous and their numbers rose.\nBefore long they became the most powerful creatures in all of F√≥dlan.\nAll was well until darkness descended from the north...a darkness that\ndevoured the earth, desecrated the heavens, and threw the world and\nits inhabitants into a state of chaos.
4889	To face this evil force, the goddess created a new well of power.\nShe gifted certain chosen individuals with sacred blood, allowing them\nto wield mystical weapons, that they may prevail against the darkness.\nThese souls, buoyed by their divine gifts, conquered the evil ones and\ndrove them back to the north. They came to be known as Heroes.
4890	The Heroes experienced unnaturally long lives, persisting for hundreds\nof years. Even after they breathed their last, the power coursing through\ntheir blood remained, leaving an indelible mark upon this world.\nThis power, passed through bloodlines, came to be known as the Crests.\nThe mystical weapons they once wielded are now called Heroes' Relics.\nAnd so the legend of a new age was born.
4891	The descendants of the Heroes sought their ancestor's power, and thusly\ntheir blood. In time, they amassed Crests, Relics, land, and wealth,\nusing all to set the land aflame with war. The goddess's power, intended\nto stem the flow of evil, became a tool of destruction, all because of the\ngreed of humanity. The goddess grieved and, heartbroken, hid herself\nin the heavens from whence she came...
4892	Under the tyranny of ruthless disorder, the people endured a long period\nof suffering. The vile Nemesis, who proclaimed himself the King of\nLiberation, delighted in war and bloodshed. Rather than rebelling against\nhis persecution, the people of F√≥dlan fell to his depths in a mad scramble\nto attain power through murder and theft.
4893	- 41 Years Before the Founding of the Adrestian Empire -\nSaint Seiros appeared in the land of Enbarr and, through the many\nunfathomable miracles she performed, spread light across the land.\nIn doing so, she joined the shattered hearts of the purest people\nof F√≥dlan, who went on to form the Holy Church of Seiros.
4894	- Imperial Year 1: The Founding of the Adrestian Empire -\nIn the first year of our calendar, the glorious Adrestian Empire was\nfounded. Its name was gifted by an oracle, and its future blessed by\nthe goddess. Its capital, Enbarr, was chosen to govern the southern\nreaches of F√≥dlan, where the divine Saint Seiros also lent her power.
4895	- Imperial Year 32: The War of Heroes -\nWilhelm Paul Hresvelg, the inaugural Adrestian Emperor, raised an\narmy in pursuit of the unification of F√≥dlan. With his might, he hunted\nand destroyed any house's territory that dared to seek more power.
4896	- Imperial Year 46: The Battle of Gronder -\nAn intense battle erupted on Gronder Field, where the houses that\nwere allied with Nemesis and the Imperial forces of the Adrestian Empire\nclashed. There, the Imperial forces emerged victorious.
4897	- Imperial Year 91: The Battle of Tailtean -\nThe houses that were allied with Nemesis once again faced off against the\nImperial forces, this time at Tailtean Plains. There, the evil Nemesis\nfinally fell and the Empire secured a momentous victory.
4898	- Imperial Year 98: The War of Heroes Ends -\nThe successor to Great Emperor Wilhelm I, Lycaon I, succumbed to\nsudden illness. The Empire, which ruled over the majority of F√≥dlan,\ntook this opportunity to put an end to the seemingly endless fighting.
4899	- Imperial Year 721: The First Mach War -\nThe Dagdan army invaded from across the sea. Though the Imperial\nforces resisted the attack and drove off the enemy, the land of Mach\nsustained considerable damage.
4900	- Imperial Year 728: The Invasion of Brigid -\nThe Empire invaded the Brigid archipelago, a land occupied by allies\nof Dagda. As penance for their refusal to surrender, the people of Brigid\nwere relegated to a life of Imperial subjugation.
4901	- Imperial Year 731: The Invasion of Dagda -\nWith the boon of a strong foothold in Brigid, the Empire mounted a\nlarge-scale invasion of Dagda. However, the fortunes of war were not\non their side, and their attack failed.
4902	- Imperial Year 747: The Faerghus Rebellion -\nLoog, a descendant of one of the houses that first quarreled with\nthe Empire, raised an army to demand independence, pulling the\nland of Faerghus into a fierce rebellion. This clash came to be\nknown as the War of the Eagle and Lion.
4903	- Imperial Year 751: The Founding of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus -\nLoog and his resistance army were victorious over the Imperial forces.\nThe Holy Church of Seiros mediated between the two, and Faerghus\nsecured its hard-won independence as the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus.
4904	- Imperial Year 801: The Leicester Rebellion -\nA rebellion broke out in the Imperial lands of Leicester, which the\nImperial army was unable to suppress. The Holy Kingdom, viewing the\nuprising as an opportunity to increase its own political sway, occupied\nthe Leicester region, formally declaring it as a territory of Faerghus.
4905	- Imperial Year 861: Faerghus Divided -\nFollowing the death of King Klaus I, three princes became archdukes and\nsplit the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus, that they may rule over it as\nthree separate territories.
4906	- Imperial Year 881: The Crescent Moon War -\nThe archduke ruling over the Leicester region of the Kingdom\nsuccumbed to illness. The lords of the Leicester lands refused to\nacknowledge the next archduke in line, instead plotting to rule\njointly as an alliance.
4907	- Imperial Year 901: The Founding of the Leicester Alliance -\nThe Leicester Alliance was officially formed after the subjugation of\nhostile nobles and the removal of all opposing forces in the regions\nof Faerghus. An influential figure from the outset, Duke Riegan was\ninarguably the heart of the newly formed Alliance.
4908	- Imperial Year 961: The Almyran Invasion -\nThe great eastern nation of Almyra crossed through F√≥dlan's Throat and\ninvaded Alliance territory. The Empire dispatched troops in order to\nhelp conquer this threat, and the attackers were just barely driven off.
4909	- Imperial Year 1101: The Construction of F√≥dlan's Locket -\nTo defend against future Almyran invasions, the Alliance, the Kingdom,\nand the Empire joined their efforts and resources to construct the\nindomitable fort known as F√≥dlan's Locket.
4910	The Five Eternal Commandments\n‚Ä¢ Dare not doubt or deny the power or existence of the goddess.\n‚Ä¢ Dare not speak the goddess's name in vain.
4911	‚Ä¢ Dare not disrespect your father, mother, or any who serve the goddess.\n‚Ä¢ Dare not abuse the power gifted to you by the goddess.\n‚Ä¢ Dare not kill, harm, lie, or steal, unless such acts are committed by the\n   will of the goddess.
4912	The goddess cares for and protects all that is beautiful in this world.\nThe goddess will never deny the splendors of love, affection, joy,\npeace, faith, kindness, temperance, modesty, or patience.\nFollow her example and, in doing so, abide her laws.
4913	A register of prominent noble houses of the Adrestian Empire.\nThis document is expressly for official use by the Church of Seiros.\nStudents are forbidden to remove or peruse this documentation.\n1179 edition.
4914	House Hresvelg\nThe most distinguished noble house of the Empire, tracing its roots all\nthe way back to Great Emperor Wilhelm. It has been the governing\nhouse of the Empire for 1,100 years. In addition to the first emperor,\nits lineage is also traced back to Saint Seiros herself, which is why\ngenerations of emperors are believed to bear the Crest of Seiros.
4915	House Hresvelg resides in Enbarr, the Imperial Capital, claiming all of\nthe surrounding territory as its domain. It boasted supreme authority\nboth within the Empire and without until the Insurrection of the Seven\nin 1171, in which much of its power was stripped away by the nobility.\nIn recent years, a series of misfortunes has plagued this storied house,\nand some believe dark clouds hover over the future of the Hresvelg reign.
4916	House Aegir\nA house of dukes possessing great power within the Empire, second only\nto House Hresvelg. The head of the house came to occupy the post of\nprime minister, rendering the title a hereditary one thereafter.\nHouse Aegir led the Insurrection of the Seven and, in many ways,\nholds the true power governing the Empire.
4917	House Vestra\nA house of marquises without a domain, existing in the shadow of House\nHresvelg. In addition to managing the darker tasks of the Empire, it is\nresponsible for the emperor's periphery affairs, including coordinating\nthings such as ceremonies and rituals, Imperial consorts, and the Imperial\nGuard. House Vestra was allied with House Aegir in the Insurrection.
4918	House Hevring\nA house of counts that has inherited rule over the Empire's domestic\naffairs, particularly those relating to administration, finance, and the\njudiciary. It frequently clashes with the Minister of Military Affairs\nover these matters. Much of its territory lies in the Oghma Mountains,\nand as such, it enjoys the fruits of a lucrative mining industry.
4919	House Bergliez\nA house of counts that has inherited rule over the Empire's Ministry of\nMilitary Affairs. It commands all of the armies that do not directly belong\nto the emperor. During times of war, the head of the house becomes the\nImperial army's commander-in-chief. Their territory encompasses most\nof the Empire's main breadbasket, Gronder Field.
4920	House Varley\nA house of counts that has inherited rule over the Empire's Ministry of\nReligion, whose main responsibility is to maintain amiable relations with\nthe Church of Seiros. However, due to the estrangement of the church\nfrom the Empire in recent years, it is now more involved with the\njudiciary, causing political strife within the Ministry of the Interior.
4921	A register of prominent noble houses of the Adrestian Empire.\nThis document is expressly for official use by the Church of Seiros.\nStudents are forbidden to remove or peruse this documentation.\n1179 edition.
4922	House Gerth\nA house of dukes that has inherited rule over the Empire's Ministry of\nthe Exterior. Diplomacy, foreign relations, and relations between various\nprovinces and the capital fall under its purview. It worked hard to secure\nthe ceasefires that ended both the Brigid and Dagda campaigns. Though\ncomplicit in the Insurrection, it remains distant from associated houses.
4923	House Arundel\nFormerly a minor noble house of the Empire. As head of the house,\nwhen Volkhard's younger sister became betrothed to Emperor Ionius IX,\nVolkhard was granted the title of Lord Arundel. Having worked closely\nwith House Aegir, House Arundel is seen as one of the chief instigators\nof the Insurrection of the Seven.
4924	House Hrym\nA house of Imperial viscounts. Resisting Emperor Ionius IX's policy\nof power centralization, it set out to join the Alliance and secure\nindependence from the Empire, but was unable to overcome the\nImperial army's intervention. In the aftermath, the house's main genetic\nline was wiped out. Its current head of house is an adoptee.
4925	House Nuvelle\nA house of Imperial viscounts with territory on the western coast of the\nEmpire, centered around its namesake harbor city of Nuvelle. The house\nflourished thanks to commerce with Dagda, Albinea, Brigid, and other\nterritories. Even still, it fell to ruin in 1175 after permitting the combined\ninvading forces of the Dagda and Brigid armies to make landfall.
4926	House Ochs\nA house of Imperial barons. Its territory occupies the northern half of the\nwestern peninsula known as F√≥dlan's Fangs. The head of the house was\nlost to the Dagda and Brigid War.
4927	House Bartels\nA house of Imperial barons. Highly ambitious, it sought out and acquired\nseveral Crests for its bloodline. In 1176, many members, including the\nhead of the house, died under unexplained circumstances. The deed was\nattributed to the heir, Emile. As his whereabouts are unknown,\nleadership of the house fell to a distant relative.
4928	A register of prominent noble houses of the Leicester Alliance.\nThis document is expressly for official use by the Church of Seiros.\nStudents are forbidden to remove or peruse this documentation.\n1179 edition.
4929	House Riegan\nThe leading house of the Leicester Alliance and descendants of one of the\n10 Elites. In the Crescent Moon War of 881, they spearheaded the move\ntoward independence from the Kingdom, as well as the establishment of a\nrepublic by its former vassals. They have held the esteemed responsibility\nof leading the Alliance roundtable ever since.
4930	The position of this house of dukes relies on the noble rank bestowed\nupon it by the Kingdom, well before the Alliance's founding. The current\nDuke Riegan's heir, Godfrey, died in an accident while on duty. While he\ndid leave behind a surviving daughter, she is presently unaccounted for.
4931	House Goneril\nDescendants of one of the 10 Elites, it is a military house that is chiefly\ntasked with military strikes and defense against the Almyran army, mostly\ndue to its territory's position in the east. Lord Holst, the next head of\nthe house, is widely renowned as the Alliance's bravest general.
4932	House Ordelia\nA house of counts with land in the east of Leicester territory. In 1167 it\nwas involved in House Hrym's rebellion, and the Empire retaliated by\nrepeatedly meddling in the house's internal affairs, leading to a sharp\ndecline in its noble standing.
4933	House Gloucester\nDescendants of one of the 10 Elites, this house of counts hails from\nsouthern Leicester territory. The current head of house is ambitious,\nexcels at public relations, and has an influential voice among the five\nnoble families with voting rights at the Leicester Alliance Roundtable,\nsecond only to House Riegan.
4934	House Edmund\nA house of margraves with land in the north of Leicester territory.\nIts beneficial trade policies, emphasizing fair use of its personal harbors,\nhave awarded the house a great deal of clout, to such a degree that it\nwas eventually accepted into the ranks of the Five Great Lords of the\nAlliance. Their current head of house is a renowned orator.
4935	House Daphnel\nDescendants of one of the 10 Elites and formerly among the Five Great\nLords of the Alliance, it lost much power due to internal discord. For the\nlast several generations, no head of House Daphnel has born a Crest.\nIn spite of this, it still maintains its status as a noble family.
4936	A register of prominent noble houses of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus.\nThis document is expressly for official use by the Church of Seiros.\nStudents are forbidden to remove or peruse this documentation.\n1179 edition.
4937	House Blaiddyd\nThis house claims Blaiddyd of the 10 Elites as its ancestor. It has ruled\nthe Kingdom for over 400 years, ever since Loog, the King of Lions,\nclaimed victory in the War of the Eagle and Lion in 751. This secured\nthe Kingdom's independence from the Adrestian Empire, after which\nLoog was crowned as its inaugural king by the Church of Seiros.
4938	House Blaiddyd resides in Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital, claiming all of\nthe surrounding territory as its domain and many of the fiefdoms in the\nnorth of F√≥dlan as its vassals. With the passing of King Lambert in 1176,\nhis older brother, Grand Duke Rufus of Itha, assumed the burden of\nruling the Kingdom in the young crown prince's stead. Even still,\nstrife and disorder continue to plague the land.
4939	House Fraldarius\nThis house of dukes claims Fraldarius of the 10 Elites as its ancestor.\nIt is one of the most ancient houses on record, even amongst Kingdom\nnobility. It is said that Kyphon, the sworn friend of Loog, the King\nof Lions, was also related to the Hero Fraldarius.
4940	House Gautier\nThis house of margraves claims Gautier of the 10 Elites as its ancestor.\nIts territory lies in the northernmost reaches of the Kingdom. As such,\nit has safeguarded Kingdom territory against incursions by the people\nof the Sreng region for over 200 years.
4941	House Charon\nThis house of counts claims Charon of the 10 Elites as its ancestor.\nTasked with negotiating between the resistance armies and the Church\nof Seiros during the War of the Eagle and Lion, the head of House\nCharon continues the tradition of a ceremonial competition within\nthe Kingdom.
4942	House Galatea\nWhen House Daphnel, once a cornerstone of the Leicester Alliance,\nwas divided in two over an inheritance feud, half of them defected to\nFaerghus and established House Galatea, which was granted the noble\ntitle of count. Much of its territory consists of a frigid wasteland where\na severe famine occurred in the early 1170s.
4943	House Rowe\nA noble house that once held territory in the northern Empire. When the\nFortress City of Arianrhod was constructed within its domain, it revolted\nagainst the Empire and pledged the entirety of its territory, including\nArianrhod, to the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus. For this contribution,\nit was awarded the noble title of count.
4944	House Kleiman\nThis house originally held no more than a lordship over a single castle in\nthe west of the Kingdom, but it was awarded the noble title of viscount\nfor its great success in the subjugation of the Duscur region in 1176.\nAfterwards, it was granted the Duscur region as its feudal estate.
4945	A record consisting largely of the world outside of F√≥dlan.\nThe author's identity is unknown, but they have clearly\nexperienced these places firsthand.
4946	Almyra\nA great kingdom to the east of F√≥dlan. Its territory borders that of the\nLeicester Alliance, with the precipitous mountain range known as\nF√≥dlan's Throat acting as the dividing line. Its people maintain a strong\nlegacy of horsemanship and relish in the thrill of battle. This vast\nkingdom is rich in fertile prairies, deserts, and mountain ranges.
4947	Albinea\nA continent to the northwest of F√≥dlan. Its frigid climate is home to\nnumerous rare and valuable species of flora and fauna. However,\nthe human population there is extremely small due to the intense cold\nand the frozen earth, which is unsuitable for growing grains or other\nfood crops.
4948	Morfis\nMorfis is the name of a metropolis of magic to the southeast of F√≥dlan,\nas well¬†as the boundless desert that surrounds it.¬†In the¬†distant past, it was\ncalled the City of Illusion. Thanks to an intricate web of trading routes,\nrumors of its profound and mysterious magic continue¬†to spread.
4949	Dagda\nA continent to the southwest of F√≥dlan. Due to its extreme distance from\nF√≥dlan, rumors of this relatively unknown world abound. Some claim\nit's a tropical rain forest, while others insist it's merely a giant, frozen\nplateau. In truth, this vast continent stretches far into the north and south\nand supports a wide variety of terrain and climates.
4950	A record consisting largely of the world outside of F√≥dlan.\nThe author's identity is unknown, but they have clearly\nexperienced these places firsthand.
4951	Brigid\nAn archipelago nested between F√≥dlan and Dagda. It is a land of plenty\nthat is often heralded as the perfect union of the gentle sea and nature's\nbounty. Both F√≥dlan and Dagda have long vied to claim this territory\nas their own.
4952	Sreng\nSreng was once the name of an enormous peninsula to the north of\nF√≥dlan. Today, only the northern half has kept the moniker, while the\nsouthern half now falls under the dominion of the Holy Kingdom of\nFaerghus. Several warlike clans call this great wasteland their home.\nCertain areas of this region are comprised of rocky desert.
4953	Duscur\nA peninsula to the north of F√≥dlan and the west of Sreng. The people\nwho once inhabited this area were decimated, and it now falls under the\ndominion of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus. The land boasts nothing\nnoteworthy to make it a desirable travel destination, but rumors of\nvaluable minerals waiting to be unearthed abound. 
4954	Oghma Mountains\nAn enormous mountain range somewhat south of central F√≥dlan.\nTo the west, it forms the border between the Empire and the Kingdom,\nsurrounding Garreg Mach and cutting across Empire territory. It is home\nto many animals and plants that cannot be found elsewhere, as well as a\nplethora of valuable mineral deposits.
4955	(Time has worn away the name, which is now illegible.)\n  ............\n1139 - 1159\n\n\nResting in the warm embrace of cherished memories.

4957	A recipe for roast duck with a concentrated berry sauce.\nEating it will restore 50 HP.\nIt seems it can be made by cooking.

301	In Remire Village, three youths pursued by bandits solicit\naid from Jeralt and his mercenaries. Together, you help\nthem fight off their pursuers and defend the village.
302	Formerly a promising young mercenary, you are now the\nnewest professor at the prestigious Officers Academy.\nStudents and faculty alike look on with curiosity as you\nengage in a mock battle between the school's three houses.
303	Your students have received their first assignment:\nthey are to accompany the Knights of Seiros to the\nRed Canyon in order to help strike down a group\nof bandits. This will be their first real battle.
304	Your house must help the Knights of Seiros suppress\nLord Lonato's rebellion at Castle Gaspard. Though you\nare told not to expect combat, the deep fog at Magdred\nWay sets you ill at ease...
305	While the plot to assassinate the archbishop shakes the\nmonastery to its core, you suspect the enemy may have\na different motivation. Anxiety abounds as the Goddess's\nRite of Rebirth commences.
306	A group of thieves led by a disowned son of House Gautier\nhas stolen a Hero's Relic and begun to run amok. Seeking\nto neutralize this threat, the church is sending your house\nthere to settle the matter.
307	The monastery is shocked to learn that Seteth's younger\nsister, Flayn, has gone missing. After an exhaustive search\nfor clues, you finally come upon a lead...
308	The Battle of the Eagle and Lion, a traditional contest of\nstrength between the three houses, has arrived. It will take\nplace at Gronder Field, which lies in Imperial territory.
309	A pattern of strange occurrences in Remire Village has\nsuddenly erupted into something far more serious.
310	Things take a turn for the worse as you and Jeralt\ninvestigate an abandoned chapel in Garreg Mach.
311	In the pursuit of justice for Jeralt, you and your students\nfind yourselves deep in the Sealed Forest.
312	Your house ventures into the Holy Tomb to receive a\nrevelation from the goddess. In that hidden place,\ndeep beneath Garreg Mach, a shocking truth is revealed.
313	The Imperial army, led by Edelgard, advances on Garreg\nMach. As everyone struggles to process this turn of events,\nthe grim reality of war fast approaches.
314	Five years after the Battle of Garreg Mach, the ruins of the\ntown and monastery have been taken over by thieves.\nUnable to leave things as they are, you and an old friend\nteam up to get rid of them.
315	Fulfilling a promise made five years ago, your former\nstudents gather once more at the monastery, as do the\nknights. However, your joyful reunion is cut short...
316	Your party travels to Ailell, the Valley of Torment, to\nmeet up with allied troops and secure reinforcements.\nIt should have been a safe march...
317	After fending off the Empire, your forces decide it's time to\nadvance. But first, you must capture the Great Bridge of\nMyrddin, a strategic crossing point over the Airmid River,\nwhich borders the Alliance and the Empire.
318	At Gronder Field, where the Battle of the Eagle and Lion\nwas once held, the house leaders of five years ago have\na fateful reunion...but this time, the contest between the\nEmpire, the Kingdom, and the Alliance is no mock battle.
319	At Gronder Field, where the Battle of the Eagle and Lion\nwas once held, the house leaders of five years ago have\na fateful reunion...but this time, the contest between the\nEmpire, the Kingdom, and the Alliance is no mock battle.
320	Fort Merceus, said to be impregnable, lies between you\nand Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. Seizing the sturdy\nfortress will require a carefully devised strategy.
321	Fort Merceus, said to be impregnable, lies between you\nand Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. Seizing the sturdy\nfortress will require a carefully devised strategy.
322	After Rodrigue's death, Dimitri reassesses his plan of\nattack. For the sake of the Kingdom, he chooses to\nforestall an invasion of the Empire in favor of securing\nhis own capital city of Fhirdiad.
323	Vastly outnumbered by Imperial forces, it becomes clear\nthat a surprise attack, followed by a short and decisive\nbattle, is the only path to victory. With this in mind,\nyou stealthily approach Enbarr, the Imperial Capital.
324	Shortly after reclaiming the Kingdom capital, a request for\naid arrives from Claude. To save the Alliance from ruin,\nyou head to Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital.
325	After tearing through Enbarr, it's finally time to storm\nthe Imperial palace. Your intention is to confront\nEdelgard, bring an end to the war, and locate Rhea,\nwhose whereabouts remain unknown.
326	After saving the embattled Alliance, you march south to\nEmpire territory. Fort Merceus, said to be impregnable,\nstands between you and Enbarr, the Imperial Capital.
327	Though the flame of war is quenched, its embers endure.\nYou travel deep underground to confront those who\nslither in the dark and bring lasting peace to F√≥dlan.
328	With Fort Merceus conquered, it's time to approach\nEnbarr, the Imperial Capital. Imperial forces stand ready\nin the city streets, intending to resist to the bitter end.
329	With Shambhala in ruins, the five-year war is finally at an\nend and a new age of peace has arrived. Not long for this\nworld, Rhea wishes to discuss F√≥dlan's future with EK00youEL00youEM00.\nBut all is not well...
330	Shambhala has fallen, but a mysterious army has emerged\nfrom its ruins, bearing the Crest of Flames on its banner.\nLeading this force is Nemesis, the King of Liberation,\npresumed dead for a thousand years.
331	After tearing through Enbarr, you proceed to storm the\nImperial palace. The time has finally come for Dimitri\nto confront Edelgard.
332	Emperor Edelgard has declared war on the Church of\nSeiros and the Crest-dominated world it has created.\nHer first move is to topple the most prominent symbol\nof the church's dominance: Garreg Mach.
333	The Black Eagle Strike Force has an unexpected encounter\nwith someone thought to have died years prior. Amidst the\njoy, your forces prepare to invade Alliance territory.
334	After seizing the Great Bridge of Myrddin, the Black Eagle\nStrike Force makes its way to Derdriu, the Aquatic\nCapital, where Claude awaits.
335	Absorbing the Alliance brings the Empire one step closer\nto a unified F√≥dlan. The Black Eagle Strike Force returns\nto Garreg Mach to plan its invasion of the Kingdom,\nunaware of the enemy lurking in the shadows.
336	With razor-sharp focus on the unification of F√≥dlan,\nEdelgard feigns a premature assault on Fhirdiad while\nthe Black Eagle Strike Force instead descends on the\nsouthern stronghold of Arianrhod.
337	The Black Eagle Strike Force, in its continued pursuit of\nF√≥dlan's unification, marches on Fhirdiad. Kingdom and\nchurch forces prepare to meet you at Tailtean Plains,\na place laden with history.
338	With Dimitri fallen on the Tailtean Plains, Rhea pulls her\ntroops back to defend Fhirdiad, continuing a war that has\nspanned five long years.
339	Five years after Rhea's disappearance, a letter that she\nwrote prior to that battle has surfaced. The mysterious\nmessage raises more questions than it answers...
340	Arianrhod, the Fortress City, lies on what was once the\nborder between the Kingdom and the Empire and is a\nvaluable strategic asset. Dimitri intends to reclaim it.
341	As Edelgard works to reorganize the army after merging\nwith Alliance troops, she receives an urgent message from\nDuke Goneril, whose forces guard F√≥dlan's Locket.
342	Interested in learning more about the legend of Macuil,\none of the Four Saints, Claude ventures out across the\nterritory of Margrave Edmund to the Sreng Region.
343	Sothis has a request for you, S0...\nAt her insistence, you travel alone to the Red Canyon,\nfollowed by curious students.
344	Dedue receives a concerning missive about his people,\nwho continue to bear the burden of oppression based on\nblame for the Tragedy of Duscur.
345	Safety for the people of the Kingdom has been a growing\nconcern, and Fraldarius territory is no exception. Felix has\nbeen called upon to help restore order back home.
346	When Catherine and the Knights of Seiros ride out to seek\nretribution against the Western Church for their attack on\nthe archbishop, Ashe is eager to accompany them.
347	Sylvain is unable to stand idly by when he learns that the\nband of thieves once led by his brother, Miklan, are again\ncausing trouble in Margrave Gautier's territory.
348	Whispers of Death Knight sightings in Garreg Mach\nexcite Caspar, but Mercedes has a much more pensive\nreaction. Something must be on her mind...
349	Annette and Gilbert hope to acquire the Hero's Relic of\nHouse Dominic from Annette's uncle, Baron Dominic.
350	Ingrid receives an unexpected proposal of marriage from a\nnoble of rising status. As soon as Dorothea hears the name,\nshe is adamantly against any engagement between them...
351	Hubert reveals some of his thoughts about the mysterious\npower aiding the Empire with strange technology. As fate\nwould have it, a visitor chooses that moment to arrive...
352	Amid riots in Hrym territory, Ferdinand learns that his\nmissing father, Duke Aegir, has been found. Lysithea,\nwho knows the area well, goes with him to investigate.
353	Without a Crest or a family fortune, Leonie has a difficult\ntime getting her hands on quality gear. Linhardt offers her\na hint about a sacred weapon anyone can wield.
354	The war in F√≥dlan has put Brigid in a precarious position.\nWith Bernadetta in tow, Petra returns to her homeland in\nhopes of avoiding a confrontation with her grandfather.
355	Lorenz receives a letter from his father, Count Gloucester,\nwho wishes for his son to resolve a territorial dispute that\nis about to escalate to violence.
356	Ignatz and Raphael, two sons of merchant families, set out\nto put an end to a series of monster attacks on merchants\nin Alliance territory.
357	Something is attacking people in the forests of Margrave\nEdmund's territory, and a Crest scholar blames Marianne.
358	Almyran forces are attacking F√≥dlan's Locket. With her\nbrother suddenly fallen ill, it is up to Hilda to take over\nthe defense. Cyril volunteers to accompany her.
359	Western Church extremists have taken over land sacred to\nCichol, one of the Four Saints. Seteth heads out to rid the\narea of them, and Flayn insists on going along.
360	Manuela and Hanneman have predictably opposite\nreactions to a disturbing rumor going around\nthe monastery.
361	The Alliance has requested aid from the monastery,\nbut the Knights of Seiros are low on personnel. Alois and\nShamir decide that the students will have to suffice...

10051	Ride over a number of days on horseback. Take a minimal\namount of food and hunt for the rest.
10052	March to the outskirts of the Red Canyon Zanado and\nhunt. Sometimes rare beasts appear.
10053	Ride on a long-distance expedition to train. Many unusual\nbeasts appear along the way.
10054	Train by marching on horseback over the treacherous\nOgma Mountains. Many unusual species of birds appear.
10055	Hunt on horseback in Gronder Field. You'll find many\nbeasts here for hunting that you wouldn't normally see.

13360	S0 fought alongside Edelgard to bring\nan end to the tyranny of a godlike being. Though EK00heEL00sheEM00\nwas wounded in the battle and lost the power of the\nprogenitor god, EK00heEL00sheEM00 remained determined to walk EK00hisEL00herEM00\ndestined path. With EK00hisEL00herEM00 legendary blade in hand,\nEK00heEL00sheEM00 will never stop standing against those who slither\nin the dark until F√≥dlan at last knows everlasting peace.
13361	S0 defeated those who slither in the dark\nand put down the crazed Immaculate One. In the\naftermath of the loss of F√≥dlan's great leading figures,\nEK00heEL00sheEM00 ascended the throne as the first leader of the\nUnited Kingdom of F√≥dlan. In EK00hisEL00herEM00 heart lived the\nindelible hope that their efforts would one day yield\nan era in which the people knew true peace and the\nhorrors of war were a hazy memory of the past.
13362	S0 helped Dimitri to finally crush the\nambitions of the Empire. After the war, Rhea stepped\ndown from her role as archbishop, and S0\nswore to lead the Church of Seiros in her stead.\nEK00HeEL00SheEM00 helped to guide the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus\nas it brought leadership to the newly unified F√≥dlan\nand worked tirelessly to create a peaceful world\nfree from the shackles of oppression.
13363	Together, S0 and Claude sent the Fell King\nNemesis, a foe from a bygone age, back to the flames of\neternity from whence he came. Afterward, Claude left\nF√≥dlan, leaving S0 to ascend the throne\nas the first leader of the United Kingdom of F√≥dlan.\nAs he took his schemes and dreams and efforts to a\nfar-off land, he hoped dearly that their joint efforts\nwould one day allow for a world where all of humanity\ncan coexist in peace and harmony, regardless of\nborders or bloodlines.
13364	As the new Adrestian emperor, Edelgard dedicated her life\nto reshaping the delicate political structure of F√≥dlan.\nWith tireless work and great sacrifice, she reformed\nthe class system to ensure a free and independent society\nfor all. In her later years, she entrusted her life's work\nto a worthy successor before finally vanishing from the\npublic eye.
13365	After his coronation, Dimitri spent his life reforming and\nruling justly over F√≥dlan. He focused particularly on\nimproving living situations for orphans and improving\nforeign relations. He was known for listening intently to\nthe voices of all, and for instituting a new form of\ngovernment in which the people were free to be active\nparticipants. He lived for his people and alongside them,\nand was thusly dubbed the Savior King.
13366	Claude returned to his homeland of Almyra and assumed\nthe role of a politically active prince. After inheriting the\nthrone, he worked to improve relations with F√≥dlan.\nIn addition to establishing new trade routes, he fostered\ntrust by sending reinforcements into F√≥dlan to help quell\nrevolts by the remnants of the Imperial loyalists. Under his\nguidance, the peoples of F√≥dlan and Almyra were finally\nable to set aside age-old prejudices, and over time,\nthe fallacies of old were all but forgotten.
13367	Hubert devoted his life fully to the service of Edelgard.\nOperating in the light and the shadows alike, he disposed\nof countless burdens facing his emperor, using any means\nnecessary. Though his ghastly appearance and imposing\ndemeanor were ever feared, he paid his reputation little\nheed, focusing instead on his loyalty to the emperor.
13368	After officially becoming the new Duke Aegir, Ferdinand\nset about reforming his territory. He overcame numerous\nobstacles to help the lands of Aegir recover. To recognize\nhis contributions during and after the war, the emperor\nappointed him as the new prime minister. Thereafter,\nhe stayed by Edelgard's side to help the Empire achieve\ngreat prosperity.
13369	After reclaiming the title of Duke Aegir, Ferdinand set\nabout reforming his territory. He overcame numerous\nobstacles to help the lands of Aegir recover, and in\nrecognition of those achievements, he was invited to\ntake part in helping to govern all of F√≥dlan.
13370	Linhardt abandoned his inherited position in favor of a\ncarefree life at Garreg Mach Monastery. There he spent\nhis days at ease, wiling away the hours at the fishing pond\nor in his private study. After his passing, a treasure trove\nof documents was unearthed, revealing the key discoveries\nhe had made during his many years of Crest research.
13371	In recognition of his achievements during the war, Caspar\nwas given the title of Minister of Military Affairs in the\nnew Adrestian Empire. Though his command developed a\nreputation for occasional recklessness, he proved an able\nleader, guiding his troops to overcome countless obstacles.\nLong after his career had ended, tall tales of the glory and\ngood cheer that he brought to his army endured.
13372	After the war, Caspar set out alone on a journey of\nself-discovery. He traveled to every corner of F√≥dlan and\neven ventured abroad now and again. It is said that he got\ninto mischief at every turn but that the victims of his\nantics, always more amused than harmed or offended,\nremembered him fondly and passed those stories on to\nfuture generations.
13373	As soon as Bernadetta inherited House Varley from her\nfather, she withdrew from all political discourse and\nfocused solely on the management of her own territory.\nBecause of this and her penchant for spending long\nperiods of time in "hibernation," she became known\nthroughout the house's history as the "Bear of Varley."
13374	Dorothea returned to the Mittelfrank Opera as soon as the\nwar was over. Thanks to her talent, the company enjoyed a\nresurgence in popularity that lasted well beyond the end\nof her own career. Once she gave up her position as a\nsongstress, she settled down to a private life of peace and\nquiet. It is said that she was very happily married.
13375	Petra returned to her homeland of Brigid and inherited\nthe throne from her grandfather. As ruler, she declared\nindependence from F√≥dlan and worked tirelessly to secure\nfriendly relations with both F√≥dlan and Dagda. Her efforts\ninspired her descendants to carry the torch she lit,\nensuring a future of peace and prosperity for her people.
13376	As a loyal vassal, Dedue dedicated his life to supporting\nKing Dimitri through his entire reign. After tending to his\nliege on his deathbed, Dedue resumed his post at Dimitri's\ngrave on the edge of Fhirdiad. There, it is said he stood\nsentinel over the peaceful realm he had helped build until\nthe end of his days.
13377	As Duke Fraldarius, Felix worked for years to revitalize\nand rebuild his territory. He became the king's right-hand\nman, serving as a trusted adviser on a range of subjects,\nespecially military affairs. Later in his life, he inherited his\nfather's nickname and was known throughout the\nKingdom as the Shield of Faerghus's worthy successor.
13378	Even after the war's end, skirmishes continued to break\nout across F√≥dlan. Bored and restless in his capacity as\nDuke Fraldarius, Felix abandoned his title, jumping at\nthe opportunity to wield a sword again. Little is known\nof his whereabouts thereafter, but even many years later,\nsoldiers continued to whisper rumors of a mysterious man\nable to deal swift death to scores of enemies.
13379	After the war, Ashe was formally knighted and appointed\nthe new head of House Gaspard, which had no successors.\nHis warm, sincere attitude toward his subjects was praised\nall over F√≥dlan, and Ashe was finally recognized as the\nideal knight he'd always hoped to be. His deeds live on\nin countless tales.
13380	As Margrave Gautier, Sylvain devoted his life to improving\nrelations with the people of the Sreng region. With oration\nalone, he succeeded in helping to create a new way of life\nfor nobles in which Relics and Crests were no longer\nviewed as necessary. Though he went down in history as\nan extraordinary lord, it nevertheless became customary\nto refer to cheaters as "sons of Gautier."
13381	Mercedes left home and opened a small orphanage in\nthe Faerghus region with her mother. There, she took in\nand raised children who had lost their families in the war,\nregardless of their blood or circumstances of birth. It is\nsaid that, in the town which grew around this orphanage,\nthe children never failed to smile.
13382	Mercedes left home and went to Garreg Mach, where she\nbecame a model cleric. She devoted the whole of her life\nto the service of the goddess and became well-loved by the\npeople, who revered her for her piety and her boundless\ngenerosity toward those in need.
13383	Annette returned to her hometown of Fhirdiad where she\ntook up a teaching position at the Royal School of Sorcery.\nShe was a gifted instructor, and many of her students went\non to become world-renowned sages. Though her talent\nfor teaching was remarkable in its own right, she was\nperhaps best remembered for effortlessly securing the trust\nand respect of her many students, as well as inspiring all\nwho knew her by living a life of kindness, cheer,\nand humility.
13384	Ingrid declined to rule House Galatea, choosing instead\nto serve House Blaiddyd as a knight. After achieving\nwidespread renown, she formed an elite order of pegasus\nknights who served as personal bodyguards to the nobility.\nShe never took a husband.
13385	When Galatea territory was seized, Ingrid argued strongly\nfor the preservation of its borders. Her request was\ngranted, and she was appointed to rule. From her new\nposition, she gave her all to ensure that the people of\nGalatea lived peaceful lives and put in years of hard work\nto reform its farming practices. Her efforts bore fruit, to\nthe people's delight, and Galatea became a land of plenty.
13386	Soon after the war, Lorenz assumed leadership over House\nGloucester and helped govern F√≥dlan as a representative\nof the old Alliance lords. His political talent yielded\nrevolutionary policy changes, many of which were of\nparticular benefit to the commonfolk.
13387	Soon after the war, Lorenz assumed leadership over House\nGloucester and joined the realm of Imperial politics as a\nrepresentative of the old Alliance lords. His political talent\nyielded revolutionary policy changes, many of which were\nparticularly beneficial to the commonfolk.
13388	Raphael returned to his hometown to serve his liege lord\nas a knight. After years of loyal service, he resigned his\nduty to devote his attention to the inn that his grandfather\nand sister had opened during his time away. Eventually\nhe became the inn's proprietor and developed a reputation\nfor astonishingly good cooking.
13389	After returning home, Ignatz persuaded his family that he\nshould become a painter. He traveled all through F√≥dlan\nand beyond, painting beautiful landscapes and captivating\nportraits of the world's cultures. His unique style set the\nartistic paradigm for a generation.
13390	Lysithea returned home to help her parents restore their\nfamily land. Years later, when the end to their hard work\nwas finally in sight, she relinquished House Ordelia's claim\nto nobility, ceding the territory to a nearby lord. Shortly\nthereafter, she and her family disappeared into obscurity.
13391	Marianne returned home to a hero's welcome. The people\npraised her talent and acknowledged her as a savior of\nF√≥dlan. Her adoptive father groomed her as his successor,\nteaching her the power of words over weapons. By the\ntime she claimed her inheritance, she had transformed into\none of F√≥dlan's most skilled orators.
13392	After the war, Hilda set politics aside and focused on what\nshe enjoyed most: crafting fashionable accessories. Her\ndesigns quickly achieved widespread popularity. With the\nhelp of her brother, Hilda then created the first artisan\nacademy in F√≥dlan, where she served as both professor\nand headmaster.
13393	Leonie joined up with the mercenaries formerly led by\nJeralt. As his greatest apprentice, she quickly took on a\nleadership role and eventually even inherited the title of\nBlade Breaker. She came to be known as Jeralt the Second,\nas she began to resemble him in all things‚Äîincluding his\ndrinking habits. She left behind many unpaid tavern tabs.
13394	Seteth remained at the monastery and worked to restore\nthe authority of the Church of Seiros. Doing away with\nhis old strictness, he adopted a tolerant stance toward all.\nHis encouragement of believers to respect those of other\nfaiths helped the people of F√≥dlan to find common ground\nwith others.
13395	Flayn disappeared soon after the war, and over time\nit was all but forgotten that she had ever existed. Many\nlong years later, however, a young woman resurfaced in\na completely transformed F√≥dlan. When she looked to\nthe man who stood beside her, she wondered if it would\nbe all right, in this new era, to call him Father.
13396	Flayn disappeared soon after the war, and after a time,\nproof of her very existence faded from memory. Many\nyears later, a young woman appeared at the monastery,\nwhich had been restored to its former glory. Speaking to\nno one in particular, it is said that she gazed at the\nentrance and reverently whispered, "I am home."
13397	Though F√≥dlan had changed, Hanneman's goal remained\nunwavering: to determine the workings of the Crests and\nto do away with the inequality caused by them. To that\nend, his research resulted in magical tools that could be\nused even without the aid of Crests. This proved to be yet\nanother worthwhile discovery by the Father of Crestology.
13398	Manuela left Garreg Mach to build her own academy in\na small, war-torn town. There, she contributed heavily to\nrebuilding efforts while teaching future generations the\nnecessary skills of survival. Though she never married or\nhad children of her own, she spent the last years of her life\nhappily devoted to her students.
13399	Gilbert returned to Fhirdiad and resumed his duty as a\nknight, faithfully serving King Dimitri for many years.\nWhen he finally retired, it is said he spent the rest of his\ndays coaching the young prince in the art of combat.
13400	Once the long war against those who slither in the dark\ncame to an end, Alois and his family moved to Remire\nVillage and lived happily as farmers. It is said that from\nthe moment he put down his sword and picked up a hoe,\nhe never so much as thought about turning back.
13401	Once all the fighting had come to an end, Alois officially\ntook up the position of captain of the Knights of Seiros.\nIn this capacity, he was much beloved, and the Knights\nbecame more unified than ever under his command. It is\nsaid that their accomplishments during his tenure were\nbeyond even what Jeralt's troop had achieved.
13402	When Rhea resigned her position of archbishop and left\nthe Church of Seiros, Catherine followed. She devoted\nherself wholly to Rhea's protection, and the two lived a life\nof quiet seclusion. Though Thunderbrand remained\nalways by her side, she came to be known by a different\nname: the Guardian of Zanado.
13403	Catherine left the Knights of Seiros and set out to travel\nacross F√≥dlan. With Thunderbrand in hand, she wandered\nthe countryside, seeking always to defend the innocent and\npunish the wicked. Her many years of heroics ensured that\nshe would always be remembered by the people as a\nbeloved folk hero.
13404	Shortly after the war, Shamir gave up the mercenary life\nand disappeared. Though she was never heard from again,\nrumors swirled persistently for years of a master archer\nturned thief who lined her pockets by shaking down all\nthose who preyed upon the innocent.
13405	Unable to serve Rhea any longer, Cyril nearly left the\nchurch. He was persuaded to stay, however, to assist\nin rebuilding the monastery he had helped maintain.\nThanks to his devoted work ethic, the Officers Academy\nwas able to reopen a few years later. When the new\nstudents took the reception hall, Cyril found himself\namong them.
13406	S0 and Edelgard ended the tyranny of a\ngodlike being. S0 was wounded and lost\nthe power of the progenitor god, but it mattered not,\nas EK00heEL00sheEM00 and Edelgard had each other. To ensure lasting\npeace, the two fought against those who slither in the\ndark, and to ensure a society where people can rise and\nfall by their own merits, they spent their lives reforming\nthe antiquated class system. They achieved much in their\ntime together, and it is said that they were sometimes\nspotted leaving the palace to privately enjoy the world\nthey had created. How they spent those precious\nmoments, none but the two of them will ever know.
13407	Paired with the end of the war, the joyous marriage of\nS0, the newly-appointed archbishop,\nand Dimitri, the newly-crowned king of Faerghus,\ngave the people of F√≥dlan much to celebrate. The two\nwere devoted to improving life for the people and to\nseeking greater wisdom in order to reform the government\nand the church from the inside out. As leaders of church\nand state respectively, at times they engaged in heated\ndebate. Even still, when enjoying a long horse ride or a\nquiet evening, they were not as the world saw them,\nbut rather two adoring spouses, desperately in love.\nThey remained as such for the rest of their days.
13408	After ascending the throne as the first leader of the United\nKingdom of F√≥dlan, S0 sought to rebuild\nthe war-torn towns and villages and to help guide the\nreformation of the Church of Seiros. After a few months of\npeace, remnants of the Imperial army joined with those\nwho slither in the dark and marched upon the capital city\nof Derdriu. The new kingdom lacked the power to repel\nthe invaders, but when defeat seemed imminent, a battle\ncry rang out from the east. Claude, the newly-crowned\nKing of Almyra, led a mighty army that broke through the\nrebel forces with ease. This show of solidarity forever\naltered the course of history, heralding a new age of unity.
13409	After a fierce battle, S0 and Edelgard finally\nbrought the tyranny of a godlike being to an end. Though\nwounded in the conflict and stripped of divine power,\nS0 continued to fight alongside the\nemperor to bring true peace. Hubert joined them in this\nfight, fulfilling his promise to confront those who slither in\nthe dark head-on. In that darkness, S0 and\nHubert formed an unbreakable bond. It is said that, as a\nmarried couple, they were totally inseparable.
13410	After ascending to the throne as the first leader of the\nUnited Kingdom of F√≥dlan, S0 announced\nher marriage to Ferdinand, who had assumed his inherited\nposition as Duke Aegir. Ferdinand overcame a slew of\nobstacles to reform his territory and that of House Hrym.\nHe chose not to accept an official position in service to\nS0, instead advising her only informally as\na spouse. History books extol Ferdinand's success as a lord\nof his territories, but make no mention of his marriage.\nThus, half of his life's work is lost to time.
13411	After taking her place as the new archbishop of the\nChurch of Seiros, S0 announced her\nmarriage to Ferdinand, who had assumed his place as\nDuke Aegir. No records remain of their lives after\nthat, but it is rumored that they retired to a peaceful life in\nDerdriu, making sweets.

Before they were officially wed, Marianne first\nreturned home to prepare for the ceremony and to study\noration and management under her adoptive father. She\nreturned under the Great Tree Moon, and became queen\nof a restored F√≥dlan in a grand wedding. The kingdom\nexperienced remarkable growth thereafter, and while\nS0 became known as a leader of incredible\nwisdom, few people of the time understood the depth of\nthe queen's influence.

13491	S0 declared the founding of the United\nKingdom of F√≥dlan at Garreg Mach and ascended the\nthrone as its first leader. Cyril served as a chamberlain,\nsupervising all general affairs. 13493	After finally saving both F√≥dlan and Rhea from crisis,\nS0 ascended the throne as the first leader of\nthe United Kingdom of F√≥dlan. 13494	As the new Adrestian emperor, Edelgard gave all she had\nto breathe new life into the government of F√≥dlan.\nWith tireless work, great sacrifice, and her devoted servant\nHubert by her side, she instituted new class reforms and\nhelped to ensure the people's independence. Hubert was\nalways close at hand, ready to dispose of unsavory burdens\nby any means necessary. In their later years, they passed\nthe fruits of her labor on to Edelgard's successor and\nvanished from the public eye. Though it is said they\nspent the rest of their lives together, it is unlikely they\never gave voice to the true depth of their affections.
13495	As the Adrestian emperor, Edelgard appointed Ferdinand\nas her prime minister, and the two devoted themselves to\nruling F√≥dlan. Their sharply contrasting views made for\nfrequent and lively debate, but with each enhancing the\nperspective of the other, F√≥dlan was better for it. As they\nworked tirelessly to create a better future, they were soon\nbound together by marriage as well. Their children,\nborn to those who had torn down the old social hierarchy,\nwere encouraged to choose their own paths.
13496	As the new Adrestian emperor, Edelgard gave all she had\nto breathe new life into the government of F√≥dlan.\nWith tireless work and great sacrifice, she instituted new\nclass reforms to ensure that people could rise on their own\nmerits. During those years, however, there was a period of\ntime in which she simply disappeared. It is said that she\nwent to the research facility of the foremost authority in\nCrests, Linhardt, who had relinquished his rank and title\nto live a life of study. There, after confirming the results\nof Linhardt's experiments, Edelgard was able to enjoy a\nrare break from her busy life. The respite was brief,\nbut they cherished that time for the rest of their lives.
13497	Edelgard, the new Adrestian emperor, appointed Caspar\nas her Minister of Military Affairs, and the two devoted\nthemselves to ruling F√≥dlan. Caspar quickly developed a\nreputation for recklessness in his duty, but he compensated\nfor it with successes in the field and was given leeway by\nthe emperor as a result. Privately, the couple's relationship\nas husband and wife was more tempestuous. Their spats\nwere frequent, but it is said that Edelgard took pleasure in\nher ability to influence Caspar, and Caspar enjoyed\nreining the emperor in from time to time. It was a strange\nbut happy union.
13498	When Bernadetta inherited House Varley from her father,\nshe tried to withdraw from politics and remain within the\nbounds of her territory, but Edelgard, the new Adrestian\nemperor, would not allow it. Instead, she demanded that\nBernadetta counsel her in governing F√≥dlan. It is said that\nthe emperor made this choice to keep herself from being\ntoo detached, and that Bernadetta was all too happy to\nprovide a more emotional perspective now and again.\nThe people of Enbarr could always tell when the two were\nmeeting by the sound of Bernadetta's panicked voice\nringing out from the palace.
13499	As Edelgard's reign as the Adrestian emperor began,\nEnbarr was restored, and with it, a certain opera house.\nSoon the Mittelfrank Opera Company put together a war\ndrama depicting the journey and sacrifice of the emperor\nand her companions, and the starring role went to none\nother than Dorothea. Edelgard initially forbade the\ncompany from staging it, but was eventually persuaded by\nDorothea's passionate performance to rescind that decree.\nIt is said that the emperor always set aside time to enjoy\nthe opera thereafter.
13500	As the new Adrestian emperor, Edelgard gave all she had\nto breathe new life into the government of F√≥dlan. To that\nend, Hanneman's research proved invaluable. Seeking to\ndetermine the nature of Crests, and to do away with the\ninequality caused by them, the Father of Crestology\nproduced magical tools that could be used even without\nthe aid of Crests. These were put to eager use by Edelgard,\nwho saw both of their dreams realized. It is not hard to\nimagine that a pair with such similar ideologies and plans\nfor the future would eventually settle into an affectionate\nand fulfilling relationship.
13501	As the new Adrestian emperor, Edelgard gave all she had\nto breathe new life into the government of F√≥dlan.\nHer first objective was to institute new class reforms and\nensure the people's independence. For that reason,\nshe sought the counsel of Manuela, whose vast array of\ncontacts, talents, and experience proved invaluable.\nShe became essential to Edelgard, and her skill as a\nphysician kept the emperor in good health for many years.\nBoth remained unmarried, and it is said that the two\nbecame extremely close over the years.
13502	After the war, Edelgard and Lysithea threw themselves\ninto the fight against those who slither in the dark.\nThe struggle was long and arduous, but not without its\nbenefits. With careful analysis of ancient techniques,\nthey discovered ways to recover the years of life that had\nbeen stolen from them. Afterwards, the new Adrestian\nemperor and Lysithea, her trusted officer, devoted the\nrest of their lives to F√≥dlan's rule. For her counsel in\ninstituting class reforms and ensuring the independence of\nthe people, Lysithea came to be known as the Wisdom of\nthe Empire. The pair of talented women ushered F√≥dlan\ninto a new age of innovation and prosperity.
13503	After his coronation, Dimitri assumed the throne of the\nHoly Kingdom of Faerghus, and his loyal vassal, Dedue,\nremained ever at his side. Among Dimitri's achievements\nwas the reconciliation with Duscur: an extraordinary effort\nthat required extensive negotiations to get past a history of\nbetrayal and oppression. It was a trying task, but Dimitri\nnever once considered giving up. While they behaved as\nlord and vassal in public, it is said that Dimitri and Dedue\nwere more like family in private. When Dimitri finally fell\nto illness, Dedue tended to his liege's deathbed, and then\ntook up a post at his grave for the rest of his days.\nWhen the time came, they were buried beside each other.
13504	After his coronation, Dimitri assumed the throne of the\nHoly Kingdom of Faerghus and spent his life ruling justly\nover F√≥dlan. At his side every step of the way was his\nright-hand adviser, Duke Felix Fraldarius. Their lifelong\nbond grew so strong over time that, when Dimitri finally\npassed, it is said that Felix's grief was more potent even\nthan the queen's. The stories of their lives were passed\ndown to future generations as chivalric tales that rivaled\nthose of Loog, the King of Lions, and his sworn friend,\nKyphon.
13505	After his coronation, Dimitri assumed the throne of the\nHoly Kingdom of Faerghus and took his friend, Mercedes,\nas his queen. Most were shocked by his choice, as she did\nnot come from a distinguished noble line. Still, when the\npeople saw her devotion to healing the damage caused by\nthe war, they decided she was the ideal match for the one\nthey called the Savior King. It is said that the couple led\nbusy but happy lives, and that they never failed to express\ntheir appreciation for one another, no matter the hardship.
13506	After his coronation, Dimitri assumed the throne of the\nHoly Kingdom of Faerghus and spent his life ruling justly\nover F√≥dlan. Their married life was\nsaid to be full of love and cheer.
13507	After his coronation, Dimitri assumed the throne of the\nHoly Kingdom of Faerghus and spent his life ruling justly\nover F√≥dlan. As they worked together to restore the Kingdom,\nthe pair fell in love and were eventually married. But while\nIngrid was happy to play the role of queen, and to support\nher husband in public and in private, she insisted on\ntaking up a weapon and serving on the front lines in battle.
13508	Dimitri assumed the throne of the Holy Kingdom of\nFaerghus and spent his life ruling justly over F√≥dlan.\nSeveral years after his coronation, he took Marianne,\nwhom he loved dearly, as his queen. Many of Dimitri's\ngreatest achievements can be traced to wisdom provided\nby Marianne, who had received tutelage from her adoptive\nfather, Margrave Edmund. The last words,\npenned with trembling hand, are: "I would not trade our\ntime together or the happiness we knew for anything."
13509	Dimitri assumed the throne of the Holy Kingdom of\nFaerghus and spent his life ruling justly over F√≥dlan.\nSome time after his coronation, he took Flayn, who now\nenjoyed a position of prominence in the church, as his\nqueen. Many speculated at first that the marriage was\npolitically motivated, but it is said that over time the love\nthey had for one another became clear to see. Their lives\nwere full of warmth and tranquility. Many years later,\nwhen Dimitri passed, his journals revealed that he had\nkept a meticulous record of all the meals he and his wife\nhad enjoyed together.
13510	Dimitri assumed the throne of the Holy Kingdom of\nFaerghus and spent his life ruling justly over F√≥dlan.\nAt his side was the knight, Gustave, who had discarded\nthe name of Gilbert and reaffirmed his oath of fealty to\nthe royal family. After many more years of service,\nin which the trust between them grew and never wavered,\nGustave finally wished to retire. Though he bristled\nslightly at Dimitri's request to look after and tutor the\nyoung prince, it is said that Gustave took on that duty\nwith due patience and solemnity for the remainder of\nhis life.
13511	Dimitri assumed the throne of the Holy Kingdom of\nFaerghus and spent his life ruling justly over F√≥dlan.\nTwo years after his coronation, he announced his marriage\nto Catherine. The people speculated wildly about how this\nunion came to be. Some said that Dimitri spent two full\nyears wooing her, while others suggested that the matter\nwas resolved by a duel. In any case, the couple worked\ntirelessly to reform the Kingdom, but despite their busy\ndays, it is said that they always found time for sparring,\nand that the clash of steel could be heard throughout the\ncastle at all hours.
13512	Entrusting the future of F√≥dlan to his friends, Claude left\nfor Almyra with Annette, whom he intended to marry.\nHe announced this fact to his father, the king of Almyra,\nwho approved of Claude's growth and Annette's wisdom\nand resolved to entrust the monarchy to them. Once he\nbecame king, Claude established a school of sorcery\nwith the intent to use it as a bridge between Almyra and\nF√≥dlan. Annette took on a role as headmaster, supporting\nClaude's dream by opening the doors to students from\nevery corner of the world. Relations between Almyra and\nF√≥dlan improved drastically as a result.
13513	Entrusting the future of F√≥dlan to his friends, Claude left\nfor Almyra with Ingrid, whom he intended to marry.\nHe announced this fact to his father, the king of Almyra,\nwho approved of Claude's strength and Ingrid's virtue and\nresolved to entrust the monarchy to them. Even after\nthey ascended the throne, Claude and Ingrid argued\nfrequently. But while the queen chasing the fleeing king\nthrough the palace was a common occurrence, the couple\nmust have loved one another deeply, for they happily\nraised many children together.
13514	Claude left F√≥dlan, entrusting its future to his friends.\nHe intended to travel to his homeland of Almyra, but his\nlove for Petra instead drew him west, to Brigid. He won\nher affection, and after receiving the blessing of her\ngrandfather, the king of Brigid, the two were wed.\nSome years later, each inherited their respective thrones.\nAs the monarchs of Brigid and Almyra, Petra and Claude\nfostered friendly diplomatic relations between the two\nregions and F√≥dlan.
13515	Claude disappeared from F√≥dlan after the war, leaving the\nnew head of House Gloucester, Lorenz, to support the\nnew United Kingdom of F√≥dlan in his stead. He proposed\nrevolutionary policies to restore the war-torn region at a\nrapid rate. When the rebuilding effort was complete,\nLorenz turned his eye toward diplomacy, seeking to\nestablish treaties of friendship with foreign nations.\nAlmyra was no exception, and when the two parties met\nfor a summit at F√≥dlan's Locket, it was none other than\nClaude, the new king of Almyra, who arrived to negotiate.\nSome speculated that this meeting had been Claude's\nscheme all along, but Lorenz and Claude both denied it.
13516	Entrusting the future of F√≥dlan to his friends, Claude left\nfor Almyra to reclaim his place as heir to the throne.\nWhen he became king, he asked Lysithea to be his queen\nwith a heart full of love, and with the hope of fostering\nfriendly diplomatic relations with F√≥dlan. Due to her\nshortened lifespan, Lysithea declined. Claude, unable to\nabandon his love for her, gave up the throne to go on a\nquest for a means to save her. Years later, he appeared\nsuddenly before her, claiming to have found a cure.\nWith her trust and love to guide him, he whisked her\naway, across the sea. It is unknown where they went.
13517	Entrusting the future of F√≥dlan to his friends, Claude left\nfor Almyra to reclaim his place as heir to the throne.\nSeveral years later, when he became king, he took initial\nsteps to open trade routes with F√≥dlan, and entered into\nnegotiations with Margrave Edmund. During this time,\nhe was reunited with Marianne, who had grown under her\nadoptive father's guidance into a wise and talented woman.\nShe offered him her aid, and as they worked together to\nsecure friendly relations between their respective nations,\nthey fell deeply in love.
13518	Entrusting the future of F√≥dlan to his friends, Claude left\nfor Almyra to take his place as heir to the throne.\nHis family saw that he had grown strong and allowed\nhim to claim his birthright. When he became king several\nyears later, he made the surprise announcement that he\nwould make Hilda his queen. Having studied with her\nbrother to prepare for this moment, Hilda demonstrated\nan uncanny talent for diplomacy, and greatly contributed\nto establishing friendly relations between F√≥dlan and\nAlmyra. The presence of a F√≥dlan-born queen for two\nconsecutive generations did much to alter Almyran values.
13519	Leonie returned to Sauin Village to repay her debts and\nmysteriously vanished afterwards. Some years later,\nwhen trade between F√≥dlan and Almyra began in earnest,\nthe village received notice that the Almyran king would be\npassing through on his way to Garreg Mach. The village\nrushed to prepare themselves. When the anticipated day\narrived, they were shocked to find Leonie at the king's\nside. She had gone to visit Claude in Almyra, and had\nended up staying to become his queen. Faced with the\nsight of Leonie in the resplendent clothing of a monarch,\nher father and the other villagers could do nothing but\nstand in mute amazement.
13520	Entrusting the future of F√≥dlan to his friends, Claude left\nfor Almyra to reclaim his place as heir to the throne.\nSeveral years later, when he became king, he took initial\nsteps to open diplomatic relations with F√≥dlan, and asked\nGarreg Mach for aid. During this time, he was reunited\nwith Flayn, who had been helping Seteth run the church.\nShe agreed to help, and as they worked together to secure\nfriendly relations between their respective regions,\nthey fell deeply in love. It is said that Seteth never learned\nof their relationship.
13521	After the war, Claude returned home to Almyra and took\nhis place in the royal family. Some years later he became\nking, and during his reign, promoted policies to improve\nrelations with F√≥dlan and protect children who had been\norphaned by the war. After he achieved his goals, he left\nthe throne to a family member and left Almyra. During his\ntravels, he encountered Shamir, who had been wandering\nthe world as a mercenary. It is known that they traveled\ntogether from that day forward, but where they journeyed\nto remains a mystery.
13522	Hubert and Ferdinand became the left and right hands of\nEmperor Edelgard, competing constantly with each other\nto see who could be the more helpful. They were\nopposites‚Äîthe Minister of the Imperial Household,\nmelancholy and merciless, and the prime minister, bright\nand compassionate. Still, they brought out the best in each\nother. As the Empire became orderly and prosperous, the\ntwo came to be known as the nation's "Two Jewels," and\nwere remembered fondly for generations to come. Some\nsay their fame made even Emperor Edelgard jealous.
13523	The marriage between Hubert, Minister of the Imperial\nHousehold, and Bernadetta, leader of House Varley,\nwas so surprising to the public that it was much talked\nabout even outside of political circles in the capital.\nBernadetta took the opportunity to survey the far reaches\nof the new Adrestian Empire, and in her absence,\nHubert took well to the management of Varley territory.\nThey proved to be an astonishingly good match,\nworking together to protect F√≥dlan from the shadows.\nIt is said that they showed their affection for one another\nby wearing matching embroidered flowers.\n
13524	After the war, the Mittelfrank Opera Company made a\nresurgence, in no small part thanks to the patronage of\nEmperor Edelgard's confidant, Hubert. Dorothea made a\ncomeback as a songstress within the troupe, which traveled\nall over F√≥dlan, putting a large share of its profits toward\nrelief efforts. The opera company was warmly welcomed\nby the war-weary people as a source of solace, and became\neven more famous than before. It was not discovered until\nmany years later that the troupe's tour had been a covert\noperation, coordinated by Hubert and Dorothea to gather\nintelligence for the Empire.
13525	Shortly after the war, Brigid renegotiated its diplomatic\narrangement with the Adrestian Empire, ending its service\nas a vassal and becoming a full ally. As part of that\nagreement, Petra, queen of Brigid, was wed to Hubert,\nMarquis Vestra. Some say that the marriage was purely\npolitical, ordered by Emperor Edelgard, while others insist\nthat it was of their own accord. Although they led busy\nlives, and sometimes lived separately. Still, their shared\nhome in the western F√≥dlan village of Nuvelle was filled\nwith their many children, suggesting a loving union.
13526	As confidant to Edelgard, Hubert disposed of every burden\nfacing his emperor by any means necessary, and excelled\nat working in the shadows. Supporting him from the front\nlines was the former mercenary, Shamir, who commanded\nthe emperor's elite troops. When the two married, they\nappeared from the outside to be little more than a lord of\nthe Empire and his dutiful wife. In reality, their nights\nwere filled with fierce combat against rebels, assassins, and\nthose who slither in the dark. It is reported that one of\nthem was known to often state that, "To find love between\nlife and death is a gift." It is unknown which of the two\nactually spoke these words.
13527	After the war, Mercedes traveled to Fhirdiad to pay a visit\nto her adoptive father. Though she introduced Ferdinand,\nshe left out the small detail that they were engaged to be\nwed. Married in secret, Ferdinand and Mercedes worked\ntogether to reform the new Duke Aegir's territory, and\nthe effort was so successful that Emperor Edelgard named\nFerdinand her prime minister. It was a busy life for him\nindeed, but as he was known to say to his government\ncolleagues, coming home to a smiling family made all the\nhard work worth it.
13528	After the war, Mercedes traveled to Fhirdiad to pay a visit\nto her adoptive father. Though she introduced Ferdinand,\nshe left out the small detail that they were engaged to be\nwed. Married in secret, Ferdinand and Mercedes worked\ntogether to reform the new Duke Aegir's territory, and\nthe effort was so successful that he was called upon to\nwork as a leader in the central government. It was a busy\nlife for him indeed, but as he was known to say to his\ngovernment colleagues, coming home to a smiling family\nmade all the hard work worth it.
13529	After the war, Bernadetta renounced her claim to House\nVarley. She married Ferdinand, the new Duke Aegir, and\nthe two contributed to relief efforts by instituting reforms\nacross their Dukedom. Due to the success of those\npolicies, Ferdinand was offered the position of prime\nminister by the emperor. He accepted, leaving the\nmanagement of Aegir territory to his wife, while he\nworked to apply their ideas to the Empire at large. Since\nBernadetta did not like to leave home, Ferdinand's life\ninvolved a lot of travel to and from the capital, but it is\nsaid he always embarked on his return home with a smile\non his face.
13530	After the war, Bernadetta renounced her claim to House\nVarley. She married Ferdinand, the new Duke Aegir, and\nthe two contributed to relief efforts by instituting reforms\nacross their Dukedom. Due to the success of those\npolicies, Ferdinand was offered the opportunity to help\ngovern all F√≥dlan. He accepted, leaving the management\nof Aegir territory to his wife, while he worked to apply\ntheir ideas to the world at large. Since Bernadetta did not\nlike to leave home, Ferdinand's life involved a lot of travel,\nbut it is said he always embarked on his return home with\na smile.
13531	After officially becoming the new Duke Aegir, Ferdinand\nset about reforming his territory. Thanks to the wisdom of\nhis wife, Dorothea, Ferdinand's policies were of massive\nbenefit to the commonfolk and brought about a swift\nrecovery.
