3	When one professor lectures many students, some will\ninevitably have trouble keeping up, while others will get\ntoo far ahead in their studies. I wonder how this problem\nmight be solved...
4	No matter the weapon, it cannot be wielded properly\nwithout ample strength and stamina, regardless of the\nskills one may possess. I've been using various training\ntechniques, but lately I feel like they all are lacking...
5	That was a fascinating lecture, but now my brain is fried.\nI feel like I need a change of pace to reinvigorate me.\nWhat do you recommend?
6	Such interesting ideas you seem to have, Professor, but tell\nme this: what would you do if you were given the task of\nteaching a subject that you yourself did not understand?
7	I am an avid arms collector. Since coming to live here,\nhowever, I have had much more trouble finding new items\nfor my collection. Any ideas as to where I might find some\nuncommon weapons?
8	When I take a lecture I'm not interested in,\nI get so...sleepy. I just can't fight it.\nI should just give up, don't you think? \nClose my eyes and enjoy a peaceful slumber?
9	Pretty soon I'll have eaten everything they have to offer\nin the dining hall. Then what am I supposed to do?\nKeep eating the same boring meals over and over again?
10	Um. Sorry, but you should probably just skip me. I don't\nhave a question to ask. How would I even think of one?
11	You know how sometimes an ordinary girl can be more\npopular than an exceptional beauty? Or how, with\naristocrats, some prefer a viscount when they could\nhave a duke instead? Why do you think that is?
12	I am having a question. I wish for improvement of my\nlance skills. But I am having uncertainty about how to\nbe training effectively. What should I be doing?
13	Though I have served His Highness for four years, he has\neluded my every attempt to learn his favorite foods.
14	Magic is not my forte. Being a gifted swordsman, I think\nmy time is best served practicing swordplay technique.\nWhy should I waste my time attending lectures, just to\nimprove my magic skills from mediocre to average?
15	I'm...kind of terrified to walk the monastery grounds at\nnight. It's unnerving how dark and quiet the place gets!\nHow can I conquer my fear?
16	I've been trying to win the heart of this girl,\nbut none of the fancy gifts or sweet things I tell\nher have worked. Do you know any secret dating\ntricks I can use to win her heart?
17	I enjoy a good ghost story, but I've never seen a ghost in\nreal life. I would love to have that experience for myself,\neven just once!
18	Lectures about strategy or reason require so much focus,\nI end up absolutely famished! But if I go to class after a\nbig meal, I can't help getting sleepy...
19	Art has never been my forte. Even when I apply myself and\nsketch a ton, I don't seem to improve much. I can envision\nan image so perfectly in my head, but turning it into\nsomething physical that I feel good about eludes me...
20	The ladies have been giving me the cold shoulder, of late.\nI believe it is because they are intimidated by my\nnoble presence. How can I be more...accessible?
21	I just wanna eat meat and fish, but everyone in the dining\nhall says I gotta eat vegetables too! I'm never gonna get full\non some stupid leaves!
22	I'm not very good at sharing my opinion. Usually, I just go\nalong with what everybody else thinks. I don't want to\nbother anyone. Um...
23	There's so much to do and never enough time in which to\ndo it. Sleep is a nuisance, but my body forces me to slow\ndown, even though my mind doesn't want to. Do you have\nany tips for shaking tired feelings away?
24	Um, excuse me... Can you help me? I always get the\nfeeling that I'm being watched. I get so nervous that I can't\nsleep at night...
25	I hate cleaning my room. It's so boring, and to be honest,\nI'm kinda lazy. But I don't want my room to get messy.\nWho do you think I should get to tidy up for me?
26	I don't care about being pretty or anything, but it bothers\nme that some people don't even realize I'm a girl.
27	I am staggered by how routinely the students seem to\nneglect their studies in favor of petty romance.\nYou should get this under control.
28	I want to be able to talk to males and make friends with\nthem, but my brother always causes such a fuss when I do.\nDo you have any advice for me?
29	When I ask them to take part in my experiments,\neven the most industrious students run away from me.\nNo matter how sincerely I plead!\nDo you have any suggestions?
30	Hey. Maybe you can answer a question I've had for a\nwhile now... Why is it that men don't like women who\nare messy?!
31	For the purpose of educating young aristocrats, the church\nborrows a number of soldiers from each country.\nAs these soldiers from different origins gather in one place,\nanimosity and fighting become frequent. It is...a problem.
32	As a member of the knights, I sometimes travel by ship for\nmy missions. But I have a bit of a weak stomach...\nWhat can I do to tamp down my sea sickness?
33	One of your students keeps challenging me to fight him,\nbut he has no idea how to wield a sword. It's a waste of\ntime for both of us. What am I supposed to do?
34	Some people hate spiders or centipedes, but they have no\nstrong feelings toward flies or crickets. Why is that?
35	I'm real happy here, but there's somebody who has\nup and decided to take pity on me. Without asking!\nIt's real darn irritating, and I want them to know it.\nI just don't know how I can make myself understood.

1	You should speak with every student you can. This might\nbe your only chance to see what they're really like before\nyou become a professor...
2	They need help taking care of the horses. And more help \nover at the fishing spot too. I'm helping out, but I have to\ndo my work for Lady Rhea first... Do ya think any of\nyour students would help out?
3	Professor, I do not mean to impose, but I wonder if you\nwould be willing to give me a little extra instruction?
4	Professor, I have a favor to ask. If you can spare the time,\nwould you be willing to provide some private instruction?
5	Hey, Teach. Mind spending some extra time with me?\nI could use a little more instruction.
6	I cannot believe how poorly maintained the saint statues\nare. Just look at them... Clutter at their feet as though that\nis even remotely acceptable!
7	Horses won't get any stronger just by eating. A lot more\ngoes into raising 'em right. Stop by the stables and you'll\nsee what I'm talking about.
8	I'm fresh out of recipe ideas. Say... Perhaps you could find\nsome for me. Maybe a student or the library's cookbooks\ncan spark some inspiration. Let me know, will you?
9	I've been thinking about starting a choir, and I need a\nvolunteer who can help me get it off the ground.\nCan you help me find some students who love music?
10	There is a ceremony related to Saint Cethleann that\nrequires rare fish. Would you mind helping me obtain\nsome, Professor? You can fish by speaking with the\nfishkeeper at the fishing pond.
11	There is a dish I would like to make, but I need more of a\ncertain vegetable to do so. I was planning to grow it from\nseeds in the greenhouse, but if you'd like to help...
12	If I have to eat in that filthy dining hall, I prefer to invite\na cute girl to dine with me. Beforehand, I'll find out her \nfavorite foods so I can order them. She's happy, I'm happy.\nI haven't missed a move! Pretty great, huh?
13	Merchants buy and sell all manner of items, but I'm only\ninterested in their works of art. Good art is like a balm for\nthe soul. Please do let me know if you get your hands\non any, Professor!
14	Hey. It seems I've lost something. When you have\na minute, can you help me look for it?
15	New knights have arrived to sell us their services, but their\nintegrity is questionable. It would be appreciated if you'd\nsee whether any are unfit to associate with the monastery.
16	Do you know about the fighting tournaments here at the\nmonastery? I hear anyone can get involved! Oh, I know!\nYou and I should sign up, Professor!
17	I made a dreadful mistake and ended up with two of the\nsame tea set. Now I must gift one of them to someone\nwho can appreciate its value. Could you help me find\nsomeone deserving of such a precious gift?
18	I won't tell you where exactly, but I came from a faraway\nplace to study here. I think we could both benefit from\nlearning more about each other. Don't you agree?
19	I'm running low on supplies. Soon, I won't have anything\nleft for forging weapons or making repairs. Sorry to bother\nyou with this, but can you fetch some materials for me?
20	I have been collecting my favorite composer's musical \nscores, but I've misplaced some of them somewhere in\nthe monastery. Would you help me look?
21	Did you know that students and professors alike need to\nbe certified for each type of soldier they lead? If you want\nto be certified for a new type of soldier, you'll need to take\na Certification Exam.
22	As a teacher, one should always be aware of one's students'\nsituation in life. Yes? The best way to do so, in my \nopinion, is to speak directly to the student. In order to \nliven up your conversation, prepare a gift for them.
23	There is solitude on the battlefield...but there are limits\nto what one can achieve alone. To be stronger,\nmore efficient...visit the battalion guild.
24	Jeralt is looking for you. I last saw him near his quarters,\nbut if he is not there, simply ask around.
25	The White Heron Cup is a competition of skill and grace\nin dance. Please encourage your house to participate.\nThat said, if you are serious about winning, be sure to\nchoose your representative carefully.
26	It's extremely important that professors tend to their own\nstudies as well. If you agree, I'd be more than happy to\nshare my knowledge.
27	A real battle this month, huh? I hear even the Knights of\nSeiros are involved. I never taught you much about tactics,\nbut there's a primer on it in my room. Give it a read.
28	Those who struggle with private concerns will sometimes\nvisit the cathedral for guidance. If you have the time,\nwhy not offer your keen insight, Professor?

71	I poured my heart out into this letter... I'd like you to\ndeliver it for me. To whom, you ask? Well, he's always\nworking his hardest, and he's not very up-front with his\ntrue feelings, but he's got an adorable way about him...
72	Would you mind delivering this love letter on my behalf?\nTo whom, you ask? Well, he's gallant, he has a\ncharming smile, and he always puts his family first.
73	I know it's inappropriate to write love letters to someone\nin her position, but I can't help the way I feel. It may only\ninconvenience her, but...could you deliver this?
74	Um. One of Dorte's...friends...is about to have a baby.\nDo you know of any medicinal herbs that will ensure\na safe delivery?
75	I'm fond of wood carving, but I lack the talent for it. I hear\nthat those to the west of F√≥dlan have mastered woodwork.\nI'd like to learn their techniques.
76	Ashe said that he'd like some more chivalric legends in\nthe library, but I'm having trouble finding any. I wonder if\nyou could acquire a book like that through trading?
77	Linhardt asked for more books on magic in the library,\nbut I can't find anything. Could you try to acquire a magic\nbook through trading?
78	Dedue asked us to add more books about gardening to the\nlibrary's collection, but I have no idea where to find any.\nProfessor, perhaps you could get one by trading for it?
79	Instructing your students should always be your foremost\npriority, but that does not mean you can grow complacent.\nYou must keep up with your own training as well.
80	You know what I remember most about Remire, after all\nthis time? Those famous oranges. That's what sticks.\nWhat I wouldn't give for a Remire orange right now...

86	The fish seem skittish lately... It's said that every five years,\nin the wake of a storm, a mystery fish appears and eats up\nall of the other fish in the pond. They call it the Big One.\nI thought that was just a legend, though.
87	Trade among merchants has boomed since we annexed\nthe Alliance territories. That is all well and good, but we\nshould not leave them defenseless, lest disaster strike.
88	It seems that, despite the danger, the merchant traffic\ncontinues to increase. We should take action,\nbefore there is an incident.
89	There's a lot more merchant activity lately, isn't there?\nThis area's still pretty unsafe, though. We should do\nsomething about it, before something bad happens.
90	It seems that the knights' presence has been encouraging\nto the merchants. It is good that the market is active,\nbut we should make certain that the area is safe for trade.
91	Some bandits are making trouble in a nearby village.\nNormally we would assist, but right now we have our\nhands full with this Lord Lonato business. So many\nto help, so little time. What do we do?
92	The knights of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus are seeking\nsomeone to train with. Kingdom knights are certainly\ntough, but I bet you could keep up.
93	Some soldiers stationed at F√≥dlan's Locket abandoned\ntheir posts. They weren't what you'd call upstanding folks.\nIt would be a real headache for us if they became bandits\nand started wreaking havoc in the towns.
94	The Adrestian Empire's Imperial guard is looking for\nsomeone to train with. They're said to be the cream of\nthe crop, but I'm certain you can hold your own.
95	Recently, pirates have been raiding coastal towns in the\nSreng Region. People say that they're attacking innocent\ncivilians and sinking merchant ships. Think you can do\nsomething about that?
96	My father has been curious about your competence as a\nfighter. After all I've seen, I don't see the need to test you,\nbut he insists that you show me your skills in a mock battle\nwith troops from House Fraldarius.

1	Welcome to the Garg Mach Monestary. Being Jeralt's\nchild is sufficient in terms of qualification. Be confident\nas you instruct your students. I have high expectations for\nyou.
2	Teachers choose one of 11 subjects to focus on each\nmonth. When choosing a subject, consider both the\nTalents of your students, as well as the extent of their\nstudies so far.
3	Students will ask you questions after a lecture. These\nqueries often seem unrelated to the class... Still,\ndo your best to answer them. This will raise your \nstudents' motivation, even if it's just a little.
4	How well a student responds to tutoring largely depends\non the student's motivation, which means it's very\nimportant for us as teachers to always be working towards\nbringing out that motivation.
5	Education is not limited to within the walls of the\nmonastery! You may assign extracurricular activities to\nseveral students. We want them to gain experiences \nthey cannot get from a lecture.
6	Boy, this monastery sure is big... I hear you can trade with\nother countries in the Market. It's almost like this\nmonastery is its own country.
7	Hmm, they're gonna let a newbie like you lead an army?\nI'm gonna be watching how you command veeery closely.
8	People in the Officer's Academy are always dropping all \nsorts of stuff. Like books, or stuff to write with... I'll never\nbe finished with cleaning up. And I like cleaning! I just \nwish everyone would be careful with their stuff.
9	It's just a statue of a worldly saint that'll give you benefits\nif you improve it. That being said, I suppose there's no\nharm in getting its blessing.
10	It seems you've grown quite comfortable in your role as a\nteacher. I've become very curious about the students in\nyour class.
11	Hehe, your students are all quite interesting, aren't they?\nI want to hear more about them.
12	Hmm... Just as this girl says, to teach others, you must also\nlearn for yourself. It should also lead you to discovering\nnew abilities
13	Hmph, they pushed quite the dangerous task on you,\nhuh? Looks like every month, you'll have to collect as\nmuch information as possible before you act.
14	Professor, here's the roster of your students' names. \nIt also lists what subject they're especially\nskilled in, as well as a little personal information, \nso do be sure to use it for reference.
15	If you don't know which to choose, why don't\nyou talk to the students again? You could aslo learn useful\ninformation by talking to people other than the students.
16	Everyone expects a high level of leadership from us \nteachers. Of course, interacting with your \nstudents is what makes you a successful teacher.
17	Before you begin tutoring a student, compare their \naptitude to the topic you're focusing on for that month. \nIf they have an aptitude for it AND it's the topic for that \nmonth, you should definitely see results.
18	Oh, yeah... be sure to check the Bulletin Board too, okay?\nThere'll be requests from students, or other teachers, and\ninformation about the Market. Handling some of those \nrequests allows you to use certain facilities, too.
19	Don't forget, time flies! Make sure you have a plan so you\ndon't spend all of your time talking with your students \nthen suddenly realize it's the day of the mock battle, \nokay, Professor?
20	The ability for a student to trust their teacher can\nlead to a greater desire to learn. You should proactively \nwork to strengthen your bonds with your students \noutside of class, as well.
21	Naturally, you, I, and Manuela each have \ndifferent strengths in education. And, so, when \na student makes a strong request, we do allow \nthem to transfer to a different House.
22	From this mock battle onwards, I'll have everyone\ncommand knights in battle. Seeing as nearly all of you will\nbe commanding armies in the near future and all.
23	You've got to let soldiers wounded in battle rest, of course.\nKeep a constant eye on how many knights you've got left.
24	If you command a troop of knights, you can launch a\ngambit against the enemy. Use Gambits well to Rattle\nthe enemy. Just be careful not to exhaust your battalion\nendurance, yeah?
25	When launching an attack at the enemy, check to see if\nthere's an ally in a position to link up with. Especially\nwhen launching a gambit, you should be doubly sure to\nlink up with an ally.
26	When you pass a Certification Exam, you may become a\nmore advanced class. However, it will be difficult to pass\nunless you've attained the required skills for that class.

3	A Lord must know how to command others. Authority is\ntherefore a must. It is also traditional to study sword\ntechnique. Will you help me with these endeavors?
4	Lords must be leaders, so strong authority should be\nconsidered a requirement. They also fight from the front\nlines, and thus need to know how to handle a sword.\nSuch are my goals... Are we aligned?
5	A Lord has to lead troops into battle, so it's important that\nI master authority. And if I'm going to hold my own in the\nvanguard, I'll need to achieve sword mastery as well.\nMight be a challenge, but nothing I can't handle.
6	I prefer to slay my enemies without having to lay a finger\non them. With that kind of power, why would I bother\nwith normal weapons? By focusing on reason, I can be\na great magic user.
7	A noble must know how to ride a horse, to be certain,\nand should know how to wield a lance, as that is the most\nobvious weapon of choice for a rider. As a noble among\nnobles, it seems natural that I focus on these two skills.
8	If I must go to battle, it's best for me to study faith and be\na Bishop. Playing a supporting role should keep me far\naway from the carnage.
9	I wanna blast through battle, cutting my enemies down\nleft and right, and the best way to do that is with an axe!\nHelp me train my axe skills so I can be a great Warrior!
10	If I have to hit someone, I want to do it from so far away\nthat there's no way I can get hit back. I think I want to\nmaster the bow, and then people everywhere will know\nme as Bernie the Sniper!
11	Most nobles seem to think magic is their birthright and\nthat commoners lack the talent for it. Help me master\nreason and train as a Warlock to prove them wrong.
12	People are calling me a Thief, but I would never be doing\nbad things. It is because I am moving very quickly without\nmy enemies noticing. This is why I must be learning the\nbow and sword.
13	My purpose is to be a shield for His Highness. Please help\nme improve my axe and heavy armor skills.
14	I've known how to swing a sword since I was a boy, but\nI still have a lot to learn before I can be called a master.\nI would ask you to help me temper my sword skills.
15	I'm not exactly the most imposing figure on the battlefield,\nso I think it's best for me to focus on my bow skills and do\nmy work from a distance.
16	You know, jousting is a popular sport in Faerghus.\nThe ladies love a guy who can joust. Speaking of...\nLet's polish up my riding and lance skills.
17	For me, there is nothing worse than seeing those I care\nabout come to harm. That's why I want to study faith and\nhelp others as a Bishop.
18	My passion has always been for sorcery! With that passion\nand some more time studying reason, I can be a powerful\nmagic user!
19	I have always admired Pegasus Knights for the versatility\nthey bring to battle. By studying flight, as well as the lance,\nI am sure to be useful no matter the terrain.
20	When I envision nobles in battle, I see them gallantly\nracing across the field on horseback, trusty lance in hand.\nIt is my duty to meet this ideal, hence my interest in\nlance and riding skills.
21	People say my muscles'll make me a great War Master,\nand I've got nothing against working on my axe and\nbrawling skills. Whaddaya think, Professor?
22	A physique like mine isn't suited to combat in close\nquarters, so I think I can be most helpful by using a bow.\nLet's hope I don't ever lose my glasses.
23	Sorcery is my natural talent, so it was inevitable that I'd\nchoose to be a Warlock. It's not easy, but no need to fear.\nI will never tire of studying reason.
24	I don't have any talents of my own, so all I can really do is\npray to the goddess. Maybe if I truly master my faith,\nshe'll show me the role I am meant to fulfill.
25	I'm pretty good with an axe, since it's a House Goneril\ntradition to learn it from a young age. Stick to what\nyou know, right? Easier that way.
26	I love bows, of course, but archery alone will never make\nme an elite mercenary. If I want to follow Captain Jeralt's\nexample, I need to hone my riding and lance skills.
27	
28	I believe I am better suited to healing than to fighting.\nRather than train with traditional weapons, then, I think it\nbest for me to focus upon my faith.

1	I hope you've had a chance to meet everyone.\nWould you like to know more about any of the\nBlack Eagles?

44	Lysithea is the daughter of Count Ordelia, and is\nprobably the youngest student here.
45	But watch out! She gets angry if you treat her like a\nchild. As for me, I do it on purpose. You have to\nmake your own fun in this place, you know?
46	Marianne is Margrave Edmund's daughter...\nand that's pretty much all I know about her.
47	She doesn't interact much with other students,\nso I wouldn't be surprised if a lot of folks here\nhave never even heard her speak.
48	Hilda is the only daughter of Duke Goneril. It seems\nher father and brother coddle her quite a bit.
49	If you look up "lazy" in the dictionary...her picture\nwon't be there because she never got around to\nsubmitting it. Not too unusual for a noble, I guess.
50	Leonie enrolled because she wants to be a mercenary.\nI think she said that her father is a hunter.
51	She's pretty blunt and as stingy as they come.\nA habitual saver, too. I think she's hoping to repay\nher village for helping to send her here.
52	You look as if you have no idea what's going on here.\nI know my way around, so I'm happy to help you\nfind your footing.
53	The monastery has some exceptional facilities that\neveryone who lives at the Officers Academy is\nwelcome to make use of.
54	For example, you can enjoy a meal with your\nstudents at the dining hall or take part in some\none-on-one sparring at the training grounds.
55	I suggest visiting the various facilities whenever you\nhave the time to spare. It's a great way to get to know\nthe students, faculty, and various workers here.
56	Have you noticed the bulletin boards placed around\nthe monastery?
57	Those contain requests people have posted, as well\nas helpful information from the market.
58	If you prove yourself by helping people with their\nrequests, certain facilities here will become available\nfor your use.
59	The bulletin board is updated frequently, so I\nsuggest checking it at least once a month.
60	You should take your time when speaking with\neveryone, but when it comes to using the facilities...\nWell, you need to be more careful about that.
61	If you use them without planning ahead, your free\ntime will be gone before you know it.
62	A great deal is expected from professors of the\nOfficers Academy, so it's important to hone\nyour skills.
63	To put it plainly, you'll need to keep expanding your\nknowledge of all disciplines, not just battle.
64	Just as students have much to learn from other\nstudents, professors can also share their knowledge\nwith each other.
65	You should consider seeking instruction from\nProfessor Hanneman or Professor Manuela. I think\nyou'll find their insight quite interesting.
66	Which house a student is assigned to depends on\nwhere they're from. That said, each professor has\ntheir own area of expertise.
67	So if a student is adamant about it, it is possible\nto switch someone from one house to another.\nPending your approval, of course.
68	Have you not been told what's expected from\nlectures here? Well, I can tell you how it works\nbased on what I've heard from other professors.
69	Before starting a lecture, it's a good idea to\ndetermine everyone's academic goals.
70	Students will want to prioritize studying things that\nwill help them achieve their aim.
71	It's probably easier to get good results if you instruct\nstudents based on their interests and specialties.
72	Of course, that doesn't mean it's pointless to teach\nsomeone things unrelated to their personal goals\nas well.
73	By looking beyond their preferences, some students\nmay find they're interested in fields they've never\npreviously considered.
74	A student's goals may change based on their studies\nor the experience they gain while on missions.
75	When that happens, perhaps you could help\nthem decide what new goals they should set\nfor themselves.
76	How motivated a student is will affect how well your\ntutoring goes.
77	To help cultivate their motivation, I think it's a\ngood idea to interact with your students as much\nas possible.
78	Please try your best to motivate everyone so that\nthey, in turn, will try hard with their assignments\nand activities.
79	At the Officers Academy, students are encouraged\nto engage in various activities in and around\nthe monastery.
80	If you instruct your students to work together as\na team, it will help to deepen their bonds and\nproduce better results.
81	Have you heard about the certification exams?\nThey take place every month.
82	Everyone here is working hard to become a certain\ntype of soldier, and those tests are how you can\ncheck to see how far we've come.
83	In order to pass the exam, you need to train enough\nto become whatever class you're aiming for.
84	Take care to develop your students strategically so\nthat they can pass their certification exams.
85	In battle, it's necessary to deploy battalions so that\nstudents can experience taking command.
86	I doubt I need to say this to a mercenary like you,\nbut if you have any questions about how to use your\nsoldiers, please, don't hesitate to ask.
87	After you hire a battalion, you'll need to decide who\nwill lead them.
88	Battalions can contain soldiers like mages and monks\nwho don't fight with weapons.
89	Be sure to think carefully about who would benefit\nmost from the support of battalion soldiers and their\nspecific skills.
90	Naturally, battalions lose endurance as they fight.
91	If you visit the battalion guild in the market, you'll\nbe able to replenish their endurance.
92	In the battalion guild, you can find various\nbattalions that aren't affiliated with the\nChurch of Seiros.
93	We're allowed to hire them if we so please, so you\nshould familiarize yourself with the guild whenever\nyou have the chance.
94	When you deploy a battalion, you can utilize its\nspecial gambit in battle.
95	If a gambit is successful, your enemy will be\nseverely shaken.
96	Joining forces with a nearby ally is a surefire way\nto enhance your effectiveness.
97	As this is your first time at the monastery,\nplease allow me to show you the ropes.
98	Both students and teachers of the Officers Academy\nare free use the facilities within the monastery.
99	For example, you can dine with others at the\ndining hall or partake in one-on-one combat\nat the training grounds.
100	I encourage you to wander around the monastery\nand lend an ear to the people living here.
101	There are bulletin boards in various places around\nthe monastery. Have you seen them, Professor?
102	There you can find requests from various sources,\nas well as information about the market.
103	If you fulfill these requests, you should eventually\nbe able to use even more of the facilities here.
104	The bulletin board gets updated frequently.\nYou would do well to check it once a month.
105	This probably goes without saying, but no matter\nwhich facility you use, it will take up a considerable\namount of your time.
106	It's helpful to plan out activities in advance so that\nyou don't mistakenly squander your time here.
107	Professors at the Officers Academy are expected\nto have exceptional leadership skills.
108	Students and teachers alike must devote themselves\nto their studies and strive to acquire great wisdom,\neven outside their respective fields.
109	Just as students receive guidance from professors,\nprofessors may also guide each other.
110	If you're interested, you should seek out Professor\nHanneman or Professor Manuela.
111	A student's house is determined by their place of\norigin, but naturally, each individual has their own\naptitudes and interests.
112	That said, if a student so desires and their current\nprofessor consents, they may transfer from one\nhouse to another.
113	If you don't yet know the proper procedure for\nlectures, I will tell you all that I know. Assuming\nthat's agreeable to you, of course.
114	Before beginning a lecture, we would be most\nappreciative if you would first make note of our\nstudy goals.
115	After all, everyone wishes to prioritize studying fields\nrelated to their goals, right?
116	I believe you can ensure better results by instructing\nindividuals based on their interests and specialties.
117	Of course, that doesn't mean it's pointless to teach\nsomeone things unrelated to their goals.
118	You never know if a student will develop an interest\nin something by overcoming their distaste for it.
119	Everyone's study goals will likely change based on\nthe experience they receive from future instruction\nor assignments.
120	When that happens, it would be greatly beneficial\nif you could advise us as to what new goals we\nshould set for ourselves.
121	No matter how passionate you are about tutoring\nsomeone, it's difficult to get good results if that\nstudent lacks motivation.
122	To increase a student's motivation, it's probably best\nto appeal to them in a variety of ways.
123	If it's not too much trouble, I would be grateful\nif you would try to pay attention to everyone's\nmotivation level.
124	Students are encouraged to engage in various\nactivities in and around the monastery.
125	By working together, students can strengthen their\nrelationships and, in time, achieve better results\nmore readily.
126	Have you heard? Certification exams are held every\nmonth at the Officers Academy.
127	To become a new class, one must first overcome the\ncertification exam for that class.
128	Needless to say, if one lacks the required abilities,\npassing will prove difficult.
129	I hope that you will plan ahead for the certification\nexams and instruct everyone accordingly.
130	Students command battalions in battle in order to\nexperience taking command.
131	Do you have experience commanding a battalion,\nProfessor? I assume so, but if not, I'm happy\nto explain.
132	When you employ a battalion, first decide who will\nlead them.
133	Not all battalions are comprised of soldiers wielding\nweapons. Some contain mages or monks.
134	Once you've ascertained the characteristics of each\nbattalion, you must think carefully about who will\ncommand them.
135	As they fight, battalions will lose endurance.
136	When that happens, you can replenish their\nendurance by visiting the battalion guild in\nthe market.
137	Battalions from various territories gather at the\nGuild. There are even some that aren't affiliated\nwith the Church of Seiros.
138	As we are allowed to hire them, you should visit\nthe Guild soon and come to your own conclusions.
139	If you deploy a battalion, you will be able to utilize\ntheir special gambit in battle.
140	If your gambit attack is successful, it can cause\nunrest among your enemies.
141	If you team up with a nearby ally, the ensuing results\nmay be quite remarkable.
142	You know, I was researching what it's like to live\nhere long before I even enrolled. Want me to fill\nyou in, Teach?
143	Students and teachers of the Officers Academy are\nall free to use the facilities within the monastery.
144	That means you can chow down with students at\nthe dining hall, or get in some one-on-one sparring\nat the training grounds.
145	As you explore the monastery, try visiting the various\nfacilities and talking to the people who live here.
146	If you haven't noticed, there are bulletin boards in\nvarious places around here.
147	You can check them out to see posted requests or to\nfind more information about the market.
148	I hear that fulfilling requests can even earn you the\nright to use more facilities.
149	The bulletin board gets updated frequently, so it's\nprobably a good idea to check it once a month.
150	Far be it for me to tell you how to use the facilities,\nbut it's a good idea to be mindful of how you're using\nyour time.
151	If you don't think about how you're spending your\nfree time, it'll be over before you know it.
152	Here at the Officers Academy, even professors\nare expected to study often to help maintain their\nstrong leadership skills.
153	In other words, students and teachers alike have to\nstrive to grow in every possible field.
154	Students aren't the only ones who have something to\nlearn from their professors. Professors can also learn\nfrom each other.
155	If you want to, you should try trading knowledge\nwith Professor Hanneman or Professor Manuela.
156	The house a student belongs to is determined by\nwhere they're from, but it is possible for someone\nto switch to a different one.
157	Of course, that's only if the student very strongly\nwants to make the change and their professor\nis on board with it.
158	Don't tell me... No one bothered to show you the\nstandard procedure for lectures? I guess it's up\nto me to save the day.
159	Before starting a lecture, be sure to first check on\nour study goals.
160	After all, students will want to prioritize studying\nthings that relate to their goals.
161	It's probably easier to get good results if you instruct\nstudents based on their interests and specialties.
162	But that doesn't mean it's pointless to teach things that\ndon't relate to someone's goals. Not by a long shot.
163	By overcoming their weaknesses, some students\nmay develop an interest in new fields.
164	A student's study goals may need to be updated\nbased on their learnings and experiences.
165	It's an important part of being Teach to counsel\nstudents like that.
166	How well their tutoring goes will depend on\na student's motivation.
167	It's possible that interacting with students on a\nregular basis will raise their motivation. Maybe.\nThen again, what do I know?
168	In any case, make sure to keep an eye on how\nmotivated everyone is.
169	Students are encouraged to partake in various\nactivities around the monastery.
170	If you have students work together, it will give them\na chance to interact, and maybe even help them\nachieve better results.
171	Have you heard about the monthly\ncertification exams?
172	If you want to become a certain class, you have to\npass the certification exam for it.
173	That means training up on the required skills\nso you can pass.
174	Don't slack when it comes to teaching your\nstudents what they need to know to pass their\ncertification exams.
175	Battalions are deployed in battle so students can\nlearn how to take command.
176	Oh, that concept may be new to a loner mercenary\nlike you, eh, Teach? Want me to explain the basics?
177	When hiring a battalion, start by deciding who will\nlead them.
178	Pay close attention to the battalion type. One may be\nmade up of armed soldiers while another is all mages.
179	As for who should lead which battalion...\nWell, be sure to think on that carefully.
180	Naturally, battalions will lose endurance as\nthey fight.
181	You can replenish battalion endurance by visiting the\nbattalion guild in the market.
182	At the battalion guild, you can meet battalions\nthat aren't affiliated with the Church of Seiros.
183	We're allowed to hire those folks, too, so be sure to\nvisit the guild later to check it out.
184	If you deploy a battalion, you can use their\nspecial gambit.
185	If you successfully pull off a gambit, you may be able\nto affect the outcome of the battle, even if just a\ntiny bit.
186	If you join forces with a nearby ally, there's a good\nchance that the results will be even greater.
187	With each moon, professors of the Officers Academy\nreceive a schedule for the month ahead.
188	It notes the days on which events and missions\nwill take place that month.
189	Pay careful attention to your schedule so that you\nmay thoughtfully plan what you intend to do\neach month, and when.
190	So, we are taking children into battle, are we? I am\nnot certain I will be able to sleep soundly after\nbeholding something like that...
191	I shall allow you to turn back the hands of time,\nbut know this power is not infinite!
192	Oh my. Is this your first time fighting such a thing?\nThen listen well to what I say.
193	An evil power has caused them to grow quite large.\nTheir life force is beyond a mortal like yourself.
194	You cannot win unless you fell them twice or\neven thrice!
195	Even if you've cornered one, you cannot let your\nguard down! Those things are even worse\nwhen threatened.
196	Can you see that barrier? It is surrounded by great\npower. You must break through to fight that thing.
197	A strong attack or gambit might help to break\nthrough more quickly.
198	If you can break the barrier, that power will have\nnowhere else to go, and that will likely cause\nconfusion for that thing.
199	It cannot counter while confused, which means that\nis the best time to attack!
200	It will not be confused for long, but every moment\nthat it cannot counter is a gift!
201	They have such might that they will not fear you\nalone. But a battalion could prove useful on\nthat front...
202	Attack them with a gambit to draw their attention\nand force them to target you.
203	Be on your guard when they have realized their full\npower! The damage caused at times like that is not\ncontained to just one spot.
204	Once they have charged some power up,\ntheir barriers will be restored. You really must\npay close attention to those things!
205	Distract them with a gambit, or just take them down\nbefore they can attack. In any case, think carefully\nbefore you act!
206	If you break down all of their barriers, not only will\nthey be confused, they will not be able to move\nfor a short while.
207	Without the power flowing around them, they will\nnot be able to restore their barriers. You might even\nbe able to get something from them.
208	But you should be conquering that thing instead of\ntalking to me! If you're out of questions, get over\nthere and fight!
209	If you become closer with the students by partaking\nin the various activities around the monastery, you'll\nbe able to talk to them about such things.
210	Is there anything else you wish to ask me about,\nregarding spending your time at the monastery\nor battles?
211	If you get to know the students better through the\nactivities at the monastery, they may approach you\nabout this.
212	Do you have any other questions about life at the\nmonastery or about battle?
213	If you do a lot of different activities around the\nmonastery, you'll get closer to students and they\nmay ask you about it.
214	Is there anything else you want to ask me, Teach?\nAbout living at the monastery or combat,\nanything like that?

281	The monastery's schedule features different events on different days.\nEach week you will have one day off, when you may choose an activity\nfrom the list. Your only option at first will be Explore.
282	Select the calendar with the directional buttons to view the schedule.
283	To recruit students from the other houses, you will need to meet their\nrequirements. Each student prioritizes different stats and skills.
284	Ask for help from a student outside your house, and that person\nwill join you for battles and missions until the end of the month.
285	You can only ask one student for help each month, and that student\nwill not earn any experience.
286	Host tea parties to bond with your allies. The charm (Cha) stats of\nS0 and guest will increase too, if you are a good host.
287	Try to pick conversation topics that you think your guests will like.\nIf they're having fun, they might choose topics of their own as well.
288	Keep your guests happy, and they will stay as long as you like.
289	You can explore the monastery as much as you like, but certain activities\nwill only be available while you have activity points.
290	When you are done exploring, press the L Button to end your free time\nand proceed to the next week.
291	Those you select to lead seminars will instruct others in their areas\nof expertise.
292	Higher skilled instructors grant more skill experience to those\nwho attend.
293	People choose to attend a seminar based on how well the subject matches\ntheir skill goals. Those with high motivation are more likely to attend.
294	Select Rest to give your house a break. This will increase your students'\nmotivation, among other things.
295	From the map screen, you can travel instantly to places you have already\nbeen. Press the R Button to open the map, select a destination, and then\npress the A Button to fast-travel.
296	Press the X Button to see where to find each character and facility\nat your selected location.
297	The monastery holds events with various effects, such as those which\nincrease the benefits of the Share a Meal activity for certain characters.
298	These events will appear on the calendar. Select Explore on your day off\nto participate.
299	Students study on their own and earn skill experience according to\ntheir skill goals. Results are reported at the end of each week.
300	You can alter students' goals at any time using the Goals menu.
301	A three-star mark next to a skill indicates that you will unlock a\nbudding talent after a certain amount of instructing.
302	Once you unlock a budding talent, that person will go on to excel in\nthat particular skill. They may even learn a new ability or combat art.
303	As students improve from instructing and personal study, they may\napproach you with suggestions for new goals.
304	Whether to accept their suggestions or not is completely up to you.\nFeel free to guide your students along paths of your own choosing.
305	You can instruct students with high motivation more frequently.
306	One way to increase motivation is to interact with your students around\nthe monastery.
307	You can assign one group task each week. Students who take part will\nearn skill experience based on your choice. You can also get gold and\nresources by completing these tasks.
308	The result of a group task will depend on the students' strengths,\nweaknesses, and affinity for one another.
309	When you pass a certification exam, you can change to a new class.
310	Benefits of high-tier classes include increased stats and growth rates.
311	You will usually want to finish exploring when your activity points\nrun out. Press the L Button to do so.
312	Access the Items menu to use, store, take, or swap items for your units.\nItems that cannot be carried will be sent to the convoy.
313	Access the Abilities and Combat Arts menus to equip your units with\nwhat they have learned.
314	Use the Battalion menu to assign battalions to your units.
315	Use the Reclass menu to switch a unit's class to any for which they are\ncertified. Classes a unit has mastered are marked with a star.
316	Your professor level determines your maximum activity points. Raise it\nby reading books, taking part in activities, and interacting with students.
317	It is easier to recruit students who like you, so try building up your\nsupport level with students you'd like to recruit. Certain non-students\nwill also become available for recruitment as the story progresses.
318	When you complete quests, paralogues, and auxiliary battles, you will\nearn renown which can be spent to restore the statues of the Four Saints.
319	As you restore the statues, you will gain various bonuses to your\nunits' growth.
320	You will need to go to battle to complete certain quests. Choose the\nBattle option on your day off.
321	This is the amiibo gazebo. When you scan an amiibo here, certain items\nwill appear at random in the monastery in all of your save files.
322	When you instruct your students, they gain skill experience. As their skill\nlevels increase, they will gain access to new abilities and combat arts.
323	The number of people you can instruct is indicated by your activity\npoints at the top of the screen. When you set up a group-task,\nthe students you assign will continue the task until you change it.
324	Auxiliary battles are now available. How often you can battle is limited\nby your activity points indicated at the top of the screen. On Normal\ndifficulty, some auxiliary battles will not cost activity points.
325	Use the Gift option to increase your support points with others by giving\nthem things they like. A gift will also increase an ally's motivation.
326	You may sometimes find lost items around the monastery. Use the Lost\nItem option to return them to their owners and increase support points.\nAs with gifts, an ally's motivation will also increase.
327	You can increase your skills by training with knights and professors in the\nmonastery. Use the Faculty Training option to benefit from their wisdom.
328	As the story progresses, Faculty Training will become Advanced Drills.\nUse this option to learn from any unit with a higher skill level than\nyour own.
329	You may now invite your allies to tea for a chance to bond. It is possible\nto invite those outside your house too, with a high enough support level.
330	You can carry your end-game data over into New Game +. End-game\nsaves and New Game + saves are indicated by a Sothis mark.
331	In New Game +, you retain your renown and hired battalions as well\nas your shop and saint-statue levels.
332	You can also use your journal to spend renown to unlock professor levels,\nsupport levels, skill levels, combat arts, and abilities gained from\nmastering class skills that you had unlocked in your cleared-game save.
333	Use the Unit Appearance option in your journal to choose your units'\nlook from options such as their monastery uniforms or war attire.\nProfile portraits and voices will not change.
334	Additionally, you may receive items containing Crest powers based on\nthe choices you made in your cleared-game save. Use your journal to\nspend renown to unlock any Crest items you do not already possess.
335	You will get higher-quality items for scanning Fire Emblem\ncharacter amiibo.
336	Each Fire Emblem character amiibo may also provide unique rewards.
337	After the first round of instruction each month, your students may come\nto you with a question. They will be motivated if they like your answer.
338	
339	
340	
341	
342	
343

349

352

354

358

364	
365	
366	
367	
368	
369	
370	
371	
372	
373	
374	
375	
376	
377	
378	
379	
380	Press the ZL Button during the player phase to trigger Divine Pulse.\nAt the end of each battle, Divine Pulse uses will be recharged.
381	Select a unit and then move next to an enemy.
382	While your unit is next to an enemy, the command window will open.\nTo attack, select the Attack command and choose a weapon.
383	Certain terrain will have effects on the unit occupying it. Forests, for\ninstance, raise a unit's evasion and defense.
384	Move your units to advantageous terrain and prepare to meet the enemy.
385	
386	When you attack an enemy that is also in attack range of one or more\nof your other units, you will trigger a linked attack.
387	During a linked attack, your avoid rate (Avo) and hit rate are higher than\nnormal. Linked attacks between certain units will also raise might (Mt).
388	Good use of linked attacks is key to defeating powerful enemies.
389	Linked attacks will also build support among the units involved.
390	Forests are not the only terrain type you will encounter. Keep an eye out\nfor others, such as thickets and heal tiles.
391	You can see the effects of terrain by placing your cursor over it. Press the\nX Button on an empty space to toggle terrain information and unit icons.
392	An item icon on an enemy indicates that you will get the item that is\nhighlighted green in the unit's Details display when you defeat them.
393	Guarding
394	Armor Abilities
395	Staggering Blows
396	Armor Breaks
397	Status Effects
398	Monsters and Gambits
399	To begin fishing, first select your bait. Wait until you see the silhouette\nof the fish you want to catch, and then press the A Button to hook it.\nDon't wait too long, though, or the fish will escape with the bait...
400	Press the A Button when the circles overlap to reduce the stamina of the\nhooked fish. Once its stamina is depleted, you will have successfully\ncaught the fish.
401	If your line breaks, the fish will escape. Durability of the fishing line\nincreases with professor level.
402	Repeated excellent timing will create combos that reduce the fish's\nstamina quickly. If you land excellent timing at all opportunities,\nyou will net a more valuable fish than usual.
403	By gardening, you can harvest all kinds of crops. Flowers, for instance,\nmake great gifts. Some people might even decorate their rooms with\nthe flowers you give them.
404	Use the Plant command to decide which seeds to use. More seeds mean a\nbigger harvest, while more compatible seeds will lead to higher quality.
405	Use the Cultivate command to pay the greenhouse keeper to look after\nyour crop. The more you spend, the better your harvest will be.
406	Your crop will be ready one week after you plant your seeds.\nUse the Harvest command to gather what you've grown.
407	Each month, people will approach the counselor with their concerns.\nSelect responses that satisfy them, and your support points will increase.
408	The monastery hosts travelers from players all over the world.\nTravelers can give you deals on items, take part in recon training,\nor join your army as adjutants.
409	Use the Local Specialty option to buy items and resources at a lower cost\nthan you would find at a shop.
410	Recon training is a challenge to locate hidden travelers. If you're\nsuccessful, you can earn resources as a reward. If you succeed\nmultiple times, you can earn a battalion.
411	A traveler hired as an adjutant will follow one of your units in the next\nbattle. Afterwards, they may sometimes teach you an ability or combat art\nthat they have equipped.
412	Playing online lets you see the behavior of players around the world.
413	You can see what percentage of players chose which activities on a given\nday, which units are most popular, and more. Referencing these statistics\nmay give you ideas about how best to spend your time.
414	If you head into battle while playing online, you may see the spirits of\nthose who perished on other players' battlefields. They are more likely\nto appear in places where death is frequent.
415	Spirits that appear in this shade indicate an area where many enemy units\nhave fallen. You can collect items that were dropped by the vanquished.
416	Spirits that appear in this shade indicate an area where many allied units\nwere lost. They can impart blessings such as experience or restored\nequipment durability.
417	A weapon will break when repeated use brings its durability to 0.\nYou can fight with a broken weapon, but your might (Mt) and hit rate\nwill be reduced, and enemies will make follow-up attacks more easily.\nBe careful with your weapons‚Äîyou cannot repair them mid-battle.
418	Chests and doors can be unlocked with the appropriate keys. Move the\nunit with the key next to the chest or door, and they will have the option\nto unlock it.
419	Once you reach Professor Level C, you can assign an adjutant to follow\na unit into battle. The number of adjutants you can assign per battle\nincreases with your professor level.
420	Depending on class, adjutants can provide one of three types of aid:\n‚Ä¢ Follow-up: Occasionally adds a follow-up attack in combat.\n‚Ä¢ Guard: Defends against and reduces damage from follow-up attacks.\n‚Ä¢ Heal: Occasionally heals the host unit at the start of a turn.
421	Select the Items option to change your equipped weapon or to use items\nsuch as the vulnerary, which restores your unit's hit points (HP).
422	Magic can provide new means of attack and defense to a unit that has\nthe skill and is of an appropriate class.
423	You must equip attack magic in place of a weapon, but you can use assist\nmagic regardless of your other equipment. All magic has limited uses,\nbut these will replenish at the end of a battle.
424	The magic your units gain access to is determined by their skills. Study\nreason to learn black or dark magic. Develop faith to learn white magic.
425	On battlefields with thick fog, your units will only be able to see enemies\nthat are close by. Proceed with caution: a unit's movement will be cut\nshort if it is interrupted by an enemy.
426	Units hit by gambits will be rattled. Rattled units cannot move, use\ngambits, or benefit from battalions, and suffer a 10% penalty to all stats.
427	When a gambit is used on an enemy within the attack range of one or\nmore of your other units, it will become a Gambit Boost. The might (Mt)\nand hit rate of the gambit will increase based on the number of units\nparticipating and their support levels.
428	Units with the Locktouch ability can open chests and doors without keys.
429	Adjutants are more effective at higher support levels. They get experience\nin battle, but do not lose weapon durability and do not die if the host unit\nis defeated.
430

432

479	
480	
481	Use the battle menu to create bookmark saves, view tutorial guides, and\nmore. To access it, press the A Button when the cursor is on a space\nwithout an active unit.
482	To move your units, select them with the A Button. Then select your\ndestination from among the blue tiles, press the A Button again,\nand your unit will move to the selected tile.
483	After moving, you will see a list of possible unit commands. To end your\nunit's action, select Wait. To cancel, press the B Button.
484	Once all of your units have taken action, the player phase ends and the\nenemy phase begins. You can end the player phase early by selecting\nEnd from the battle menu.
485	To start combat, first select one of your units using the A Button.\nThen select an enemy within the attack range highlighted in red.
486	Bows can attack from long range, although their hit rate is reduced as\nrange increases. They are highly effective against fliers like pegasus\nknights and wyvern riders.
487	
488	Combat arts are powerful techniques that use more weapon durability\nthan usual. They do not typically allow for follow-up attacks.
489	The Combat Forecast will be shown before you commit to an attack.\nIf the attack speed (AS) of one unit is greater than the other's by 4\nor more, the faster unit will strike twice. This is indicated by a "x2"\nnext to the attack's might (Mt).
490	If your weapon or magic is particularly effective against the enemy's type,\nyou will inflict triple the weapon or magic's might (Mt) in damage.
491	Some combat arts gain bonus damage against certain types of enemies.\nIn these cases, the damage will be double the weapon's might (Mt).
492	Cavalry and fliers have the Canto ability, which allows them to use their\nremaining movement (Mv) after taking certain actions.
493	Some weapons and combat arts inflict status effects, such as lowered stats\nor poison. Different status effects have different durations.
494	All status effects expire naturally, but you can also recover from them\nearlier by using items like antitoxins or white magic such as Restore.
495	In Casual Mode, units whose hit points (HP) are reduced to 0 retreat\nfrom battle and return afterward. In Classic Mode, they are lost forever.
496	If S0's hit points (HP) are reduced to 0 in Classic Mode,\nthe game is over. In Casual Mode, it only ends if your army is defeated.
497	To restore a unit's hit points (HP), use an item like a vulnerary or white\nmagic such as Heal.
498	Units standing on restorative terrain, like heal tiles and strongholds,\nwill restore hit points (HP) at the start of the turn.
499	If you place two of your units adjacent to one another, they will be able\nto use the Trade command to swap items.
500	A speech bubble by one unit when you select another indicates that the\nunits have something to say. Use the Talk command while they are\nadjacent, and the conversation will build support between them.
501	Units can build support levels with other specific units. As support\nlevels between units increase, so too do the benefits they receive\nby fighting alongside one another.
502	Actions around the monastery can build support among your units. Once\nsupport between two units reaches a certain threshold, a conversation\nwill take place and the support level will increase.
503	Enemy reinforcements may sometimes approach from strongholds\nand stairs.
504	While your cursor is over an enemy, a danger radius showing their attack\nrange will appear. Press the A Button and the radius will remain visible.
505	Choose the Auto-Battle option in the battle menu to allow your units to\nact independently for one turn. You can cancel this function by pressing\nthe ZL Button.
506	Paralogue battles branch away from the main storyline and focus on the\nside stories of specific units. By completing these battles, you can gain\nunique items and battalions that pertain to these side stories.
507	Some paralogues feature units from outside of your house. You can\ncontrol these units while in these battles, but they will not earn\nexperience or acquire items.
508	Units learn new combat arts when their weapon skill levels go up. There\nare no combat arts for reason or faith‚Äîthose skills grant magic instead.
509	Units with Crests have special abilities. Each Crest is unique; move your\ncursor over the Crest in a unit's Details display to learn more.
510	Choose the Units option to determine whom to send to battle. Press the\nA Button to toggle a unit. Units highlighted in green cannot be excluded.
511	Choose the Inventory option to sort items, equip abilities or combat arts,\nassign battalions, or change your units' classes.
512	Choose the Map option to see the area and the placement of your units.\nOnce your preparations are complete, select Fight! to begin battle.
513	While exploring the monastery:\n     R Stick: Move Camera\n     +/- Buttons: Zoom In/Out\n     B/Y Buttons (Hold): Dash
514	If you are ever unsure what to do next, look to the left side of the screen.\nYour current objectives will be displayed there.
515	Quests are tasks given to you by people around the monastery.\nThose who can give or are involved with quests will have icons by them.
516	Consult the Quests menu to see the quests you have accepted. The icons\nbeside each quest indicate their status. Icons for essential quests are red.
517	The minimap in the upper-right corner of the screen shows your current\nlocation, the locations of important people, the direction to quest givers,\nand more. Zoom or change the map view with the ZR Button.
518	S0 can use the Convoy command at any time. Other units\ncan trade with the convoy while they are adjacent to S0.
519	Use the Mount and Dismount commands to switch cavalry and fliers\nbetween fighting on their mounts and on foot. The unit's type will\nchange to infantry or armored while dismounted.
520	Press the ZR Button to toggle a danger area for all enemy units.
521	This mysterious blade unleashes its true power in S0's\nhands, extending to reach distant enemies. The weapon's durability is\nrestored by 5 each time S0 chooses Rest on EK00hisEL00herEM00 day off.
522	Use the Inventory menu to assign battalions to your units, granting them\nincreased stats like attack (Atk) or hit rate. These stats will grow further\nas a battalion gains experience fighting alongside you.
523	A battalion whose endurance is reduced to 0 will withdraw, providing no\nbenefits until replenished at the battalion guild.
524	Once per battle, using Sothis Shield grants +7 resistance (Res) to all\nallies. The effect decreases each turn and ends after 3 turns.
